artcl_ctt:
? And around the world... millennium bug worries are subsiding.
? The International Y-2-K Cooperation Center says... things are looking good so far... with most countries that have rolled into the year two thousand... being computer mess free.
Korea is one of them... reporting no major computer-related difficulties.
Seoul''s Ministry of Information and Communication says... key services are running smoothly... including phone, electricity and operations at the nuclear power plants.
Planes are taking off and landing as usual today from Kimpo International Airport.?

?Meanwhile... an 8-day standoff involving that hijacked Indian Airline... has ended after ? a prisoner-for-hostage exchange agreement.
India''s National Security Adviser.... Brajesh Misra... said today... his government has agreed to exchange 3 prisoners... for the 160 people aboard Flight 814.
Sources say five hijackers were seen getting on a van to leave the site at Kandahar.
Shortly afterwards the hostages were trasferred on to four buses that were standing by.
Their destination was not immediately known.
Misra said this was the result of negotiations between the Taliban and the hijackers... who''d been demanding three militant Islamists be released.
The Taliban''s a Muslim fundamentalist movement... controlling most of Afghanistan... which had refused to get involved at first... but agreed to intervene back on Wednesday.
Misra said he expects all the hostages to return to New Delhi by half past midnight... Korea Time.?

? A flashing red light and beeping sounds warn users... that their privacy is being invaded.
The beeping sounds become more frequent... as the scanner gets closer to the bug.
The Spy Capture detects surveillance devices... like phone taps and hidden cameras.
Shaped like a cellular phone... it can be used for up to ten hours at a time... without a change of batteries.
The maker of the Spy Capture is a firm called the Y-L Data System.
Company officials say they wanted to come up with a product... that''s more compact than existing ones... and affordable to the general public.
With a maximum scanning frequency of four-gigaherz... the firm says its product should be able to detect virtually any commercial surveillance device... out on the market.
As for future plans... company officials say negotiations are underway... with potential buyers in several countries including Japan, China, and Singapore.
Suk Min Arirang TV.?

? It''s seven o''clock Friday, December 31st, 19-99.
Good Morning.
On this last day of the year... most of Korea is looking to enjoy clear skies... with warmer than usual temperatures.
Morning lows are from minus two to five degrees Celsius...
Seoul is right now at zero.
Highs today will be between four and twelve degrees.?

? That is our report for this Friday, December thirty-first, 19-99.
Thank you very much for watching.
We''ll see you in the new millennium... same time tomorrow morning.
Have a great Friday!?

? To usher in the new year... Seoul hosted a gala event in the Kwanghwamun district.
? The first part of the overnight extravaganza... which kicked off just before midnight... featured a torch-lighting... a car parade... and a count-down to the year 2000.
Then when the clock struck midnight... spectators were able to witness the birth of this year''s first babies... and see the colorful 1999 kites flying... symbolizing Korea''s wish for peace.
Celebrations continued well into the early morning hours... with people determined to make an unforgettable start to the new millennium.?

?December 31st... 1999.
On this final day of the millennium... a surprise announcement out of Moscow, Russia... where President Boris Yeltsin said he''s calling it quits.
Political observers say because of his resignation... Russia will likely plunge into another crisis... with a scramble to get ready for unexpected presidential elections.

? Looking pale and grim on national TV, Boris Yeltsin said he had turned over his power to Prime Minister Vladimir Putin.
He said presidential elections would be held in 90 days to replace him.
Yeltsin also appealed to Russians to forgive him for what he said had been the errors of his administration.
He was quoted as saying ... Russia is creating a new precedent of civilized transfer of power from an old president of Russia to a new one. 
He said he is leaving earlier than his term because he understood the need to do this.
Russia has experienced years of economic decline and millions live in poverty.
The Kremlin has been under constant political attack during the past year with widespread allegations of corruption.
Vladimir Putin who had already declared he would run for president has reportedly indicated he would continue Yeltsin''s democratic and market policies.
He also hinted of mixing moderate reform with the need for a strong government to crush widespread corruption.?
artcl_titl: Yeltsin resigns#Boris Yeltsin resigns as Russian President#
artcl_titl_en: Yeltsin resigns#Boris Yeltsin resigns as Russian President#

artcl_ctt:
? Hope your Friday is going well.
Welcome to Arirang News on this last day of 19-99.?

? That is our report at this hour.
Thank you for watching.
We wish you all a happy new year!?

? And now... here''s a message of hope and unity from President Kim Dae-jung.
Following the President''s new year address... will be short greetings from the National Assembly Speaker and the Chief Justice.
Let''s listen.

? "My fellow Koreans!

The new millennium and the 21st century have dawned.  On this meaningful morning, I wish you good health and happiness.  I also hope all 75 million of our compatriots living in other parts of the global village, including North Korea, will be blessed this year.

Today we stand at a new starting point with grand dreams and hopes.  It is the beginning of our effort to contribute to world peace and prosperity by making a leap forward in joining the ranks of advanced countries.

We have the potential to make these dreams and hopes come true.  It is we who achieved democracy on a land once devastated by dictatorship.  It is we who saved the economy from bankruptcy.  And it is we who, with our ardent desire for reconciliation, are pursuing an engagement policy toward North Korea amid worldwide support.

We Koreans can meet the requirements of the knowledge-based era of the 21st century better than any other peoples.  High intellect and cultural creativity are what we have.  Moreover, Korea is geo-politically surrounded by such large markets as the United States, Japan, China and Russia.  The 21st century represents an opportunity and a blessing for us.

What we need now is the spirit of challenge.  We need the kind of courage shown in the gold-collection drive, if we are to march into the new millennium.  We must turn the 21st century into a grand era for the Korean people.

There is a saying that what''s well begun is half done.  Our future in the 21st century depends on how we start this year.  That is why I have come up with the following five policy guidelines that will help us shape the "New Millennium, New Hope."

The first is to achieve national unity.  The second is to complete governmental reform.  The third is to create a society of intellectuals.  The fourth is to mold Korea into an economic superpower.  And the fifth is to promote inter-Korean cooperation.

This year, I will focus all my efforts on realizing these five policy goals.  I believe this is the best way to make the 21st century our century.  More than anything, I will do my best this year to improve the quality of life for the middle and low classes.

My fellow Koreans!

We have passed a century of trials and entered a century of hope.  A glorious future is opening before us.

Our dreams and hopes are clear.  And the national tasks that are needed to achieve them are also clear.  We cannot hesitate any longer.  Let us overcome the conflict and confrontation of the past and join in the national march toward unity and hope.

I would like to share with you this emotional moment of welcoming the "New Millennium, New Hope."

Happy New Year!

?
? No one can know for sure how the new millennium will evolve or what it will turn out to be.
Considering the eventfulness and speedy pace following the ordinance prohibiting topknots and the 100 years since then leading to this internet age, it is certain that there will be radical reforms and development.
Even in such a period, if we can independently adhere to liberalization and reforms, and advance democratic politics through love, harmony, and generosity, the new era will turn out to be a world of justice, kindness and sincerity.
Once again I wish the people a happy new year full of hope, peace and humanistic sense of reward.
?Thank you.

Choi Jong-young,  Chief Justice

With the new millennium, the Supreme Court will improve the current justice system to better prepare for the future.

We will work even harder to earn people''s trust by appropriately practicing the right to judge.

The court will aim to make the process of the law as well as the final verdict, acceptable and understandable for all sides involved.

The court will work to provide speedy and fair trials to all citizens at affordable fees. ?
artcl_titl: DJ New Year Address, 국회의장, 대법원장 신년사
artcl_titl_en: DJ New Year Address, 국회의장, 대법원장 신년사

artcl_ctt:
? The Vice Premier of the Chinese State Council began his 10-day visit to Russia on Monday.
Li Lanqing first stop was at one of Moscow''s city schools.
He looked at the school''s textbooks on China and listened to a performance by local students, singing in Mandarin.
The goal of his trip is to strengthen bilateral relations between the two nations.
He''s scheduled to attend a Chinese-Russian commission on Tuesday to further cooperation in education, culture, health care, and sports.?
artcl_titl: Chinese big wig goes to Russia.
artcl_titl_en: Chinese big wig goes to Russia.

artcl_ctt:
? Once again... the sights and sounds that we''re bringing to you right now... are from downtown Seoul... in particular, the 광화문 area... where the local time''s just gone past __(time)__.

? This particular segment of Korea''s millennial celebrations... are being broadcast to other countries around the world as well.
The gala event is said to be the largest-ever to take place on the Korean Peninsula... with more than a hundred-thousand performers... and a million citizens taking part.

? We mentioned earlier... there was a torch lighting ceremony at 5 p-m today (or yesterday) on 변산반도... and that there will be another one at around 7-20 tomorrow (or this) morning on Tokdo.
These torches will join a third torch... lit on the South Pacific island of Fiji... by the WORLD''s first sunlight of the new millennium.
All of them will then be taken to Korea''s southeastern port city of 포항... where its own torch will be lit as soon as the first sun of the year comes up.

? In that city... the four torches will come together to form the Torch of Eternity... which is to be housed in the Millennium Gate.
That''s one of the Twelve Gates of Peace that are currently under construction... and will be completed in the year 2002.
And as the name says... the Torch of Eternity will forever symbolize peace... and provide light for other torches in international events.

? Now... the Presidential Commission for the New Millennium has been very secretive about some of the events planned for tonight.
The so-called X-File events include things like... a live Internet broadcast of the birth of the millennium baby... and the Seoul Peace Declaration by our very own President Kim Dae-jung and 4 Nobel Peace Prize laureates... including former Polish Prime Minister Lech Walesa.

? The visit to Earth by galaxy ambassadors that we''re about to see (or we saw)... was also kept under wraps until the last minute.
And there are many more surprises that are to be unveiled during the second half of the 광화문 celebrations... that half beginning at the strike of midnight and the customary tolling of the Poshingak bell.?

? With the economy on the mend... the number of Koreans travelling overseas has shot up over the past year.
But the government says... Koreans were travelling on a tighter budget this time around.
Here''s our report.

? More Koreans may have travelled abroad this year... but they didn''t spend as much.
The Culture and Tourism Ministry reports... this year''s calculations show little difference from 19-98... when the nation''s economy was at its lowest in history... and people watched every won they spent.
? On average one traveller used 774 dollars... that''s just a year-on-year increase of 63 dollars.
Compare that to the pre-crisis level of 19-97... when each person spent about 1,500 dollars.?
Officials say... considering the fact that the won strengthened against the dollar... Koreans really didn''t spend that much more this year.
4-point-4 million people are believed to have left the peninsula this year... nearing the pre-crisis level.
Tourist officials say... some 50 percent more Koreans chose to take long trips abroad this year... to places like England, France and Sweden.
Meantime... foreign visitors'' spending on the peninsula is on the decline as well.
Each foreigner who came to the peninsula this year is found to have spent about 1,200 dollars about two hundred dollars less than last year.?

? It certainly was a grand way to usher in the new millennium... wasn''t it, Chulho?

? It sure was, Junghyun.  And the celebrations aren''t quite over yet.  After the birthday party that we just saw... there will be what we Koreans call the 고풀이 dance.

? Keeping in line with tonight''s overall theme of ''peace''... the dance will be a sort of prayer for world peace.
The perfomers will include about a hundred foreign dignitaries, tourists, workers and businessmen.

? They''ll be holding the hems of 188 long strips of cloth... tied to a pole at the center... which they''ll be dancing around.
Each strip representing each country in the world... with its own national flag and the word ''peace'' written in the native language.

? That''s sure to be quite a spectacle as well.  And that''s still not the end of these millennial celebrations.
The party will go on in the 광화문 area for another hour or so.
Might be worth checking out... if you happen to be in the neighborhood...
If only to get a closer look at the grand celebrations going on in Seoul.

? Even if you can''t... we certainly hope you''re finding your own little ways to celebrate the dawning of the new millennium.
From all of us here in the news team, though... that''s all we have for you tonight.
But do stay tuned to a special performance coming up right after this.

? The program''s titled "Kim Mae-ja''s Dance: the Eye of Heaven"... and it''s something that we''ve prepared for this once-in-a-thousand-year occasion. So enjoy!

?  We''ll say our goodbyes now...
Thanks for watching Arirang News... and our special "2000 Live Coverage: Into the New Millennium."

?	 As we say in Korean...
?
?
 새해 복 많이 받으세요.?

? Also from the Bank of Korea... the country''s foreign exchange reserves surpassed 74-billion dollars.
? That''s a remarkable 25-percent jump... from 98... which ended at 48-point-5 billion dollars.
The central bank attributes the sharp increase to three factors...
Current account surplus... greater foreign capital inflow... AND local banks repaying foreign currency loans to the BOK.?

? New Millennium... New Hope...
That was the main theme behind President Kim Dae-jung''s new year address.
The President stressed the importance of starting off on a good footing... and to show HIS resolve to do just that... he unveiled his policy resolutions for the New Year.
Ahn Junghyun has this report.

? (music and SOT for a few seconds)
President Kim Dae-jung began his New Year''s remarks... by wishing every Korean on earth... including those in North Korea... good health and happiness.
His speech was all about getting the 21st century off to a good start... a century which he said would be THE era of the Korean people.
? "(SOT) There is a saying that what''s well begun is half done.  Our future in the 21st century depends on how we start this year."
He went to great lengths to talk about the potential Korea has... to become a global power and contribute to world peace and prosperity.
And as a way to start the first year of the new millennium on firm footing... the President outlined his five policy goals for the year.
Those being... national unity... completion of national reforms... creation of a society of intellectuals... ? economic advacement... and promotion of inter-Korean cooperation.
He said he would focus all of his efforts on realizing these five goals.
And he didn''t forget to pledge... he would do everything in his power to improve the quality of life for the lower-income class.
In opening the new millennium of hope... President Kim asked that the Korean people hesitate no longer...
? "(SOT) Let us overcome the conflict and confrontation of the past and join in the national march toward unity and hope."
Ahn Junghyun... Arirang TV.?
artcl_titl: PK for 1/1 DJ New Year #DJ New Year Remarks#
artcl_titl_en: PK for 1/1 DJ New Year #DJ New Year Remarks#

artcl_ctt:
? In other news... Korea sees more cash in circulation.
? The Bank of Korea says... in just two weeks starting mid December... it released more than 5-and-a-half trillion won... or 4-point-9 billion dollars.
That''s four times greater than the amount for 98... and a trillion won more than the Chusok holidays... when the demand for cash was at its peak.
The central bank says... an increase in domestic consumption and concerns about the Y2K... have prompted people to withdraw more cash than any other year.?

? And in downtown Seoul...
A gala event will kick off at Kwanghwamun tonight... at eleven.
? The first part of the extravaganza will feature a torch-lighting, car parade... and a count-down to the new year.
Then after the clock strikes twelve... spectators will get to watch the birth of the first babies of the new millennium... and the flying of 1,999 kites... symbolizing the country''s wish for peace.
For those in the expatriate community who would like to be a part of celebrations... you can join the organizers in front of the Dong-a Daily News Building at the Sejong-ro intersection at 11 tonight.
400 seats are available for the festival.
For those of you who cannot make it out to Kwanghwamun tonight... Arirang T-V will be broadcasting the event... live... straight after our evening news at eleven.?

artcl_titl: Y2K 대비로 시중에 자금 많이 풀려
artcl_titl_en: Y2K 대비로 시중에 자금 많이 풀려

artcl_ctt:
? And in news affecting our wallets...
Gasoline prices will go down by 15 won per liter from Tuesday, January the fourth... and beer will be about two percent cheaper starting tomorrow.
But the cost of Korea''s traditional liquor soju... will go UP by about 20 percent.
? The changes in beer and soju prices are in accordance with the revised liquor tax law.
The nation''s largest soju producer, Jinro... says it''s absorbing some of the price hike... as the government has promised follow-up measures like lowering the price of spirits... the main ingredient for soju.
Meanwhile, domestic beer producers... including HITE and OB... are expected to slash their prices by about 2-point-6 percent.?
artcl_titl: Gas Rate to Drop 15 Won, Soju Price to Rise 20%
artcl_titl_en: Gas Rate to Drop 15 Won, Soju Price to Rise 20%

Considering the eventfulness and speedy pace following the ordinance prohibiting topknots and the 100 years since then leading to this internet age, it is certain that there will be radical reforms and development.
Even in such a period, if we can independently adhere to liberalization and reforms, and advance democratic politics through love, harmony, and generosity, the new era will turn out to be a world of justice, kindness and sincerity.
Once again I wish the people a happy new year full of hope, peace and humanistic sense of reward.

artcl_ctt:
? The year 2-thousand is drawing near... and so is the Y2K computer glitch.
Some countries are already experiencing a premature strike by the millennium bug...
Retailers and credit card users in Britain were in a bind Wednesday... over a Y2K-triggered system failure.
That story in detail... in our next report.

? Thousands of small retailers in Britain were struggling with credit card transactions when swipe card machines failed to work, Wednesday.
The credit authorization machines... made by Racal Electronics... hit a glitch, ticking over into a four-day data-checking period that includes January first, 2000.
The millennium bug affected the payment system used by the banking giant, H-S-B-C Holdings.
According to the electronics company, some 20-thousand of its terminals... including 14-thousand operated by H-S-B-C... were malfunctioning.
Shopkeepers had to go through time-consuming telephone authorizations when the swipe card machines improperly rejected customers'' cards... during the busy post-Christmas shopping rush.
Meanwhile, in the U-S... some 5-thousand residents of Jacksonville, Florida received electricity bills due January third, 1900.
Utility officials quickly sent out apology letters to affected customers and added that payments should be made by the third of January, 2000.
The glitch occurred despite the fact that Jacksonville officials had spent three years trying to prevent such mishaps in its water and electricity billing systems.
Overall, though, the full impact of the Y2K computer glitch won''t appear until mid-to-late January... according to the head of a U-N sponsored task force.
Bruce McConnell... who leads the International Y2K Cooperation Center... says experts won''t be able to tell what the overall impact is until the third week of January.?
artcl_titl: 영국. 체코 유사 y2k 발생#Y2K impact#
artcl_titl_en: 영국. 체코 유사 y2k 발생#Y2K impact#

artcl_titl_en: imf 한국 경제 회복 예상보다 빨라

artcl_ctt:
? The National Assembly has extended its 209th special session by eight days...
? That means... the session will continue until the 7th of next month.
The floor leaders of the ruling and opposition parties say... they plan to take care of all pending bills... including that on election law revisions... by that deadline.
Lawmakers also decided today... to keep the political reform committee going until next Wednesday...
The committee''s operating term had expired yesterday.?

? Hello and welcome to Arirang News for Thursday, December 30th.
Most of Korea is going to start the day under clear skies.
But clouds will start moving in later on, bringing a chance of rain or snow at night.
And it looks like skies will remain mostly cloudy into the new year.
Right now, in the capital, we''re seeing minus three degrees Celsius.?

? That''s the news at this hour.
Join us throughout the day for more updates.
And in the meantime, have a great Thursday.?

artcl_titl: 김 대통령,박 검찰 총장 사의 반려
artcl_titl_en: 김 대통령,박 검찰 총장 사의 반려

artcl_ctt:
? On this week''s company spotlight we feature Samhongsa. They make everything from model trains to gas springs heres more.

? Samshongsa is a name that''s known to perhaps few amongst us... 
But then again... among collectors of miniature trains... it may be the only name that counts.
The firm''s technology and craftsmanship over the years has enabled it to garner a major share in the global market for such trains.
Scaled-down miniatures hand-made or mass produced... to resemble real trains old and new ... in the most intricate detail.
Requiring anywhere between 500 to 3,000 parts... the trains are made of brass, zinc or plastic... and fetch sometimes about as much as what it would cost to buy a good car.
The firm''s reputation for painstaking precision ... has spawned the manufacture of other products such as miniscule electric D-C motors... gas lifts and springs... and electric bidets.
And success has come in the form of increased overseas demand leading to exports amounting to over 60 million dollars this year.
?? "Since the establishment of the company in 1970, we''ve focused on the overseas market. While we''re competing with foreign competitors we''ve accumulated? superior precision technology knowledge and come to know how we can survive the harsh competition in the overseas market. That made it possible for us to survive the financial crisis three years ago. 
In order to survive more competition, we need to develop more, develop new products so more portion of our revenue should be turned into the R&D sectors".
For this company at least... it''s all about getting to the next level. 
Yon Seong-hun, Arirang T-V.?

? Stock markets around the world will be sorry to see such a banner year go...
? U-S stocks surged to new records Wednesday... with only two days of trading left.
The Dow Jones Industrial Average gained nearly 8 points... to 11-thousand 484.
And the tech-driven NASDAQ composite index... marked its first close above the milestone 4-thousand... jumping more than 69 points... to 4-thousand 41.
For the whole year... the index recorded an unprecedented 84-percent growth... while the Dow soared 24-percent... and the broadly-based S-and-P 500... 19-percent.
This kind of bull run was seen in other markets as well... Japan, Great Britain, Germany, France, and Hong Kong... among others.?
artcl_titl: 나스닥 4000 돌파#Wall street closes at record high#
artcl_titl_en: 나스닥 4000 돌파#Wall street closes at record high#

artcl_ctt:
? The Korean men''s volleyball team is headed for the 2000 Sydney Summer Olympics.
The squad secured a spot after sweeping the Asian qualifiers.
Our next report has more on Korea''s last game in the round... against China.

? The Korean men''s volleyball team will be making its fifith consecutive appearance at the Olympic Games... next summer in Sydney.
The players made it official... after winning all three games in the Asian qualifiers... held in China.
Korea''s final match was against the home team in Shanghai last night.
The team went into the game... with two wins under its belt...
The players defeated the squads from Taiwan and Japan in earlier matches.
A win wasn''t necessary... all that the Korean team needed was to pick up two sets...
But, the team charged ahead from the start...
and won the game in three straight sets...
making it a sweep in the qualifying round.
The stars of the night were Kim Se-jin (김세진) and Shin Jin-shik (신진식)... with their powerful spikes.
The top scorers of the game... Shin tallied 16 points... while Kim added on another 11.
The players say their success in the qualifying rounds has boosted their confidence... and adding, their next goal is a medal in Sydney.?
artcl_titl: 남자배구: 5회 연속 올림픽행#Men''s volleyball team headed for 2000 Olympics#
artcl_titl_en: 남자배구: 5회 연속 올림픽행#Men''s volleyball team headed for 2000 Olympics#

artcl_ctt:
? British authorities have recovered the flight data recorder from the ? Korean Air cargo plane that crashed last week... near Stansted Airport... north of London.
The jumbo jet went down shortly after takeoff... killing all four crewmen on board.
Investigators used heavy equipment to dig out two engines from the wreckage... and found the black box at the bottom.
Officials say the flight data recorder is in good shape... as was the cockpit voice recorder, or the other black box... which was found the day after the accident.
British investigators say the flight data recorder will be analyzed within a few days.?
artcl_titl: KAL 화물기 블랙박스 찾아#KAL black box recovered#
artcl_titl_en: KAL 화물기 블랙박스 찾아#KAL black box recovered#

artcl_titl: 금호 주가 조작 관련 박찬구 사장등 기소
artcl_titl_en: 금호 주가 조작 관련 박찬구 사장등 기소

artcl_ctt:
? With the information age upon us, the internet is fast becoming a necessary tool in our society.
Companies have now started trading over the Web...
It is projected that the pattern of general traditions, such as overseas marketing, trade counseling, parts supply to abroad and payment will be dramatically changed due to e-commerce.
Cyber trading will take standard business practices and make them applicable over the computer. 
This saves time, money and resources.
Cyber trading is a phenomenon which started just a few years ago with the advent of services such as e-mail and Electronic Data Interchange, or EDI.
? "Back in 1995, the U-S Department of Commerce helped small and medium sized businesses establish an information network for exporting goods.
The World Trade Center Association and other world trade organisations adopted the network and began encouraging their members to utilize it to promote international trade."
Korean businesses are turning to internet trading to change with the times and open new markets.
Hyundai Corporation wanted to improve the lines of communication with vendors and customers.
So they developed a 24 hour web page service which allows buyers to inquire, order and purchase Hyundai''s products on-line.
The web page also offers a network service which connects buyers to other small and medium sized companies.
Last month the company earned 2 million dollars from on-line purchase orders... a figure that''s expected to rise.
? "We have a lot of experience with how to deal with trading off-line, so we tranferred this experience in the Internet circumstance.
We are one of the pioneers to set up the Internet circumstance in Korea in 1997.
We are focused on Internet trading."
L-G corporation began plans to implement a tradecard system this past summer, which will simplify international trade processes.
The company also has a web page which offers up to date information about products and services, including an electronic shopping mall.
LG''s chemical division cut purchasing costs by 10 percent operating an Open Purchasing Electronic Network (OPEN).
This system cuts delivery time, increases purchasing efficiency and alleviates bottlenecks.
Smaller companies are also taking advantage of the Net.
Companies like International Phone Trade, which sell used cellular phone via e-mail and in-house chatting program, utilizes just two people and two computers to run their business.
Organisations like the Korea International Trade Association and the Small and Medium Industry Promotion Corporation are using an on-line trading service web site set connect different sectors of trade.
The internet aids businesses by creating efficient networks which increase profits and save valuable resources.
We''ll take a look at the obstacles and future trends of e-commerce.
Kim Boram Arirang TV.

? Korea''s Green Cross says its medicine exports broke 50 million dollars this year... for the first time in the country''s history.
Until now...  exports of raw materials for medicine only enjoyed such earnings.
Since the start of this year... Green Cross has been  exporting price competitive products such as a vaccine for hepatitis B... which has been approved by the U-S Food and Drug Administration.
In fact... the hepatitis B vaccine is cited as the biggest single item earner... raking in 25 million dollars... which makes up HALF of Green Cross'' s export earnings.?

? The government''s going to pay 5 and a half percent more for rice next year.
? Under the revised bill passed by the National Assembly... the price of an eighty-kilogram sack of first-grade rice... will be about 160-thousand won, or 140 US dollars.
However... the government plans to buy LESS next year... in line with a World Trade Organization mandate... under which governments have to cut the volume of rice and barley they purchase... when they increase farm subsidies.
Last month... Seoul announced it would raise the amount of such aid.?
artcl_titl: 국회: 수매가 5.5% 인상#Purchasing price of rice to go up#
artcl_titl_en: 국회: 수매가 5.5% 인상#Purchasing price of rice to go up#

artcl_titl: 금호 주가 조작 관련 박찬구 사장등 기소
artcl_titl_en: 금호 주가 조작 관련 박찬구 사장등 기소

artcl_ctt:
? To mark the turn of the millennium... Koreans staged a special play.
? In North Kyonggi Province, last night... performers gathered at Imjin Pavilion... to commemorate the coming year... and wish for reunification of the peninsula.
Nine leading local performers, video artists and photographers joined efforts to put on this unique performance... which featured King Sejong and two tiger figurines... representing prosperity and peace.?

? A growing number of bankrupt firms are getting back on their feet... thanks to the efforts of their workers.
? Employees started taking over their worksites in the event of bankruptcy... in 19-96.
Such cases have soared in recent times... due to the outbreak of the financial crisis two years ago.
According to the Korea Center for Employee Ownership... 104 out of 127 companies are now up and running again... following worker take-overs.
Experts say the high success rate is due to a heightened sense of responsibility... stemming from the workers'' ties to their acquisitions.
They also add that worker take-overs help prevent more people from losing their jobs and livelihoods.?
artcl_titl: 근로자가 기업 살린다#Workers'' efforts to save bankrupt firms#
artcl_titl_en: 근로자가 기업 살린다#Workers'' efforts to save bankrupt firms#

artcl_ctt:
? France, meanwhile... is reeling in the aftermath of its worst storms in decades...
The Paris government has declared ? two-thirds of the country... natural disaster areas.
This is to speed up insurance claims and relief efforts... following the weekend gales that killed at least 70 people.
The government also mobilized 6-thousand troops... to help clear fallen trees... repair homes... and deliver drinking water to residents suffering from supply cuts.
Plus... a hundred million francs... or about 15 million US dollars... will go to recovery operations.
The storms first struck northern France on Sunday, before ripping through the south on the following day.?
artcl_titl: France,60개주에 자연 재해 지역 선포# France Declares Natural Catastrophe #
artcl_titl_en: France,60개주에 자연 재해 지역 선포# France Declares Natural Catastrophe #

artcl_titl: 식품 관리 체계 일원화 방안 추진
artcl_titl_en: 식품 관리 체계 일원화 방안 추진

artcl_ctt:
? Later in the newscast... we''ll be hearing from a person working in Korea''s computer industry... an expert on the Y-2-K issue.
So, please stay tuned.

In other news... a major turnabout for the country''s inflation rate.
The government says... the end of the year is seeing the rate at its lowest in more than three decades.
Here''s more from the Finance Ministry.

? Despite the much applauded growth of ten percent... the Korean economy has managed to keep its prices in check this year.
? Infact, the inflation rate dropped to its lowest in 34 years... to point-8 percent.
The rate is even better than expected... considering external factors such as the ? sharp increase in oil prices during the final months of the year... and this summer''s flooding.
According to the Finance Ministry... if such negative factors were excluded... the inflation rate would''ve recorded a mere point-3 percent.
For the stable prices... the ministry has picked several reasons... including... the government''s determination to keep prices and interest rates low... stronger won... and changes to the retail network.
Many wholesalers popped up around the nation this year... helping to keep prices low.
Looking at the changes in prices... the sharpest increase this year is reported from the agricultural sector... with 7 percent.
Public utilities went up two percent... while oil added just over one percent.
Meantime... housing and service costs slipped slightly by four and one percent respectively.?
artcl_titl: 올 소비자 0.8% 상승, 사상 최저#99 posts lowest inflation rate#
artcl_titl_en: 올 소비자 0.8% 상승, 사상 최저#99 posts lowest inflation rate#

artcl_ctt:
? Israel released 26 Palestinian prisoners as part of ?the latest efforts to bring peace to the Middle East.
Wednesday''s release was the first time Israel had freed Palestinians who killed Israelis or tourists.... as part of a negotiated peace process.
Relatives of those who were killed in terrorist attacks appealed the move... delaying the prisoners'' release for several hours.
But Palestinians complained that those who were freed only had a few more months to serve... demanding a larger number of prisoners be released... including those with longer sentences.?
artcl_titl: 이스라엘 PLO죄수 석방# Israel Frees PLO Prisoners #
artcl_titl_en: 이스라엘 PLO죄수 석방# Israel Frees PLO Prisoners #

artcl_titl: 인천 화재 유족, 인천 시청 난입
artcl_titl_en: 인천 화재 유족, 인천 시청 난입

artcl_titl: 조폐창 지폐 유출은 허술한 보안관리 때문....
artcl_titl_en: 조폐창 지폐 유출은 허술한 보안관리 때문....

artcl_titl: 조폐창 지폐 유출은 허술한 보안 관리 때문
artcl_titl_en: 조폐창 지폐 유출은 허술한 보안 관리 때문

artcl_ctt:
? As always... let''s first see what the local papers are saying this morning... 

? In all the dailies ... in his year-end speech President Kim said he''ll grant a sweeping pardon to one-million people... mostly people who committed financial crimes or minor offenses, like traffic violations.
The amnesty comes in commemoration of the new millennium.
According to the chief executive, the amnesty will also include two long-term prisoners as well as seven labor activists and dissidents.

And major stock markets around the world are closing the year with a bang...
The Dow Jones Industrial Average soared 24-percent for the year... the S-and-P 500 was up 19-percent... while the tech-heavy NASDAQ recorded an unprecedented 81-percent growth.
The bull run was also seen in other markets ... Japan, Great Britain, Germany, France, and Hong Kong among others.
As for Korea... the benchmark KOSPI rose 83-percent for the year.

And in sports news ... the Korean men''s volleyball team scored a valuable win against their Chinese opponents... overpowering the home team, 3-nil.
The Korean athletes beat out both the Japanese and Chinese teams in the pre-Olympic qualifying matches, which were held in Shanghai.
That means Korea''s volleyball players will be making their fifth consecutive appearance at the Olympic games.

Getting to our top story.?

? Hello and welcome to Arirang Newsroom update.

? Here are some of the top stories...
? Authorities have recovered the flight data recorder from the KAL cargo plane that crashed near Stansted Airport... north of London.
The jumbo jet went down shortly after takeoff last Wednesday... killing all four crewmen on board.
Investigators used heavy equipment to dig out two engines from the wreckage... and found the flight data recorder... commonly known as the black box... at the bottom.
Officials say the flight data recorder is in good shape... as is the cockpit voice recorder, the other black box... which was found a day after the accident.

? The Korean men''s volleyball team has secured a spot in the 2000 Sydney Olympics.
It will be Korea''s fifth consecutive appearance at the Olympic Games.
Last night... the national squad beat the Chinese team in three straight sets ... in the final game of the Asian qualifiers in Shanghai.
Korea has won all three games in the qualifying round.
The stars of the night were Kim Se-jin (김세진) and Shin Jin-shik (신진식)... with their powerful offensive plays.

? France has declared natural catastrophe zones across two-thirds of the country... after suffering through a series of devastating winter storms.
The announcement is to speed up insurance claims and relief efforts from the weekend gales... which killed at least 70 people.
The French government also mobilized 6-thousand troops to help clear fallen trees, repair homes, and deliver drinking water.
One hundred million francs, about 15 million US dollars...  will also go to recovery efforts.

That''s it for now.
Please join us in two hours'' time for more updates.
Take care.?

? In the United States... two major cities plan to mark the turn of the millennium in different manners.
The Capital is hosting a day long outdoor party... with the President on site...
But... over on the West Coast... officials in Seattle have decided to tone down their celebrations... to avoid holiday mishaps.
Let''s take a look.

?Oscar winning film maker Steven Spielberg will release his latest film during the millenium celebrations on the Mall in Washington DC.
?"So what we put together, John Williams and I is a 20 minute kind of musical and poetic celebration of why we are all here today, what were the shoulders we stood on to achieve this moment in time and history. And to kind of look back over the last hundred years and say thank you. And then to imagine beyond to the next hundred years."
Spielberg''s creation is only a small part of the day long extravagana that will culminate in a three-hour show presided by President Clinton.
Security is expected to be tight in wake of recent warnings of possible terrorist attacks,
but organizers of the Mall celebrations promise a good time.
However.... in Seattle officials there are being extra precautious... calling the city''s millennium party off.
The afternoon concerts will proceed as planned and fireworks will still go off at midnight.
But the public will have to watch the fireworks from afar because the 75 acre grounds around the center will be cleared and locked at 6 P-M.?

? On this eve of the year 2000... people around the world are bracing themselves for possible Y2K computer chaos.
? Although authorities are reassuring people that the rollover will be smooth... a number of incidents ARE creating some nervousness.
The latest being in Britain... where credit card transactions stopped after 20-thousand cashier terminals broke down.
That was due to a four-day data-checking period which ran over the new year.
Meanwhile... 5-thousand people of Jacksonville, in Florida, U-S... got their electricity bills due on January 3rd, 19-00... instead of 2000.
Countries like Russia say they''re fully ready... but places in and near the former Soviet bloc... are still being called a Y2K hotspot.
And... people in Finland... are said to be stocking up on iodine supplies to protect against possible effects of nuclear radiation.
Meantime... the cities of Seattle and Sydney have opted to forego huge millennial festivities... over concerns about Y2K-related accidents.?

? This year''s tax revenues are expected to climb as much as 10 percent from last year... to total nearly 75 trillion won or about 67 billion dollars.
? The Finance-Economy Ministry says that''s about 3 trillion won more than previous expectations.
Revenue from stock market transactions grew a whopping 420 percent from last year... to 1-point-1 trillion won.
Meanwhile, income from value-added taxes that are levied on consumer goods and services .... rose 32 percent... to reach 19-point-5 trillion won.
Next year''s tax revenues are forecast to go up another 3 to 5 trillion won... lowering the current budget deficit to under 3 percent of the G-D-P.?
artcl_titl: Korea-tax#Tax revenues up 10 pct this yr#
artcl_titl_en: Korea-tax#Tax revenues up 10 pct this yr#

artcl_ctt:
? Korea''s exports to the United States this year... are forecast to hit a record 25 and-a-half billion dollars.
? The previous record... set back in 19-95... was already broken last month.
The top export items are semiconductors and cars...
And electronic appliance shipments totalled nearly 8-point-2 billion dollars... as of the end of last month.
That''s a 25 percent increase from a year ago.
Meanwhile, Hyundai''s automobile exports to the U-S in the first 11 months of the year... amounted to around 150-thousand units.
That''s a surge of 80 percent from last year.
Kia and Daewoo also enjoyed brisk sales abroad.
The combined dollar value of the three companies'' shipments... stands at a little more than 4-billion dollars.?
artcl_titl: 대미 수출 호조#Exports to US sets new record#
artcl_titl_en: 대미 수출 호조#Exports to US sets new record#

artcl_ctt:
? Tax revenues this year are expected to swell by 10 percent... compared to last year''s total.
The Finance-Economy Ministry links this to the booming stock market... as well as a rise in consumer spending.
Here''s more.

? 75 trillion won or about 67 billion dollars.
That''s what the government says it expects to collect this year in taxes.
The finance ministry says that represents a rise of about 10 percent from last year''s figure... and 3 trillion won more than earlier forecasts.
As of November ... though... the ministry reports total tax revenue stands at 71 and a half trillion won.
What contributed to the increase?
A boost in consumer spending for one.
So far this year... the nation''s consumer''s spent enough for the government to amass 19 and a half trillion won from value-added taxes... 
That''s a rise of 32 percent from last year.
Then there''s also this year''s bull run on the stock market.
The government currently levies a 0-point-15 percent tax on all buying and selling of stocks... 
Revenue from the Seoul bourse... jumped by 420 percent from last year... to 1-point-1 trillion won.
The special consumption tax... abolished in early December... also contributed about 2 and a half trillion won.
But taxes on financial interest income fell about 17 percent from 19-98... to total 5-point-8 trillion won.
One finance ministry official predicts next year''s tax revenues will go up another 3 to 5 trillion won... to lower the annual budget deficit to under 3 percent of the gross domestic product.
That deficit now stands at 3-point-4 percent of this year''s national budget of 85 trillion won.?
artcl_titl: korea-tax-pk#Tax revenues rise 10 pct from last yr#
artcl_titl_en: korea-tax-pk#Tax revenues rise 10 pct from last yr#

artcl_ctt:
? And during the LUNAR new year holidays... there will be more trains running across the nation.
? The coming lunar New Year falls on February 5th, 2000.
So, train services will be increased starting February third through the seventh.
According to officials... there will be 704-daily rail services... that''s regular services plus 73-extra trains.
Lunar New Year''s is one of the busiest travel seasons of the year in Korea... as millions go to their hometowns to celebrate the traditional holiday with family and friends.?
artcl_titl: 철도청, 설 특별 수송 계획 마련#More trains in operation during lunar New Year''s#
artcl_titl_en: 철도청, 설 특별 수송 계획 마련#More trains in operation during lunar New Year''s#

artcl_ctt:
? On the down side, though... Korea''s export prices have been sinking at an alarming rate this decade... faster than those of other Asian economies.
? This is from the Korea Instititue for Industrial Economics and Trade... under the Commerce Ministry... quoting IMF statistics.
The think tank says prices of Korean exports have fallen an average 5 percent every year since 19-90.
That''s in sharp contrast to Taiwan''s average RISE of 4 percent... and Japan''s 1-point-4 percent.
Singapore posted a decline of just 2 percent.
The institute says the falling prices were mainly due to efforts by local exporters... to maintain their price competitiveness in the global market.?

artcl_titl: 정형근 의원 사과 하면 고소 취하
artcl_titl_en: 정형근 의원 사과 하면 고소 취하

artcl_titl_en: 추락 화물기 블랙박스 수일 내 분석

artcl_titl_en: 미 ,육군 한국전 양민 추가 학살 조사 연기

artcl_ctt:
? From the new year... two special measures, that were implemented to revive the real estate market... will be no longer.
? That means transfer taxes will have to be paid... when housing units are bought and sold...
An exception is when each side owns only one home.
However, these home-owners will also have to pay the transfer tax... if they sell their house within three years of purchase.
In addition... people who buy and sell newly-built homes... will not benefit from tax exemptions... as they would have this year.?
artcl_titl: 새해부터 양도세 면세 혜택 사라진다#Transfer tax to be revived for real estate#
artcl_titl_en: 새해부터 양도세 면세 혜택 사라진다#Transfer tax to be revived for real estate#

artcl_titl: 대우 캐피탈 등 워크아웃 약정 체결
artcl_titl_en: 대우 캐피탈 등 워크아웃 약정 체결

artcl_ctt:
? And the year 2000 looks promising as well... with analysts predicting another rally... for ? stock markets in New York and Japan.
Wall Street insiders say... once markets recover from a widely-anticipated US interest rate hike... New York''s key indices will be able to maintain their climb.
Even small and mid-sized companies are expected to see their share prices surge next year... as they were generally undervalued this year.?
artcl_titl: 증시 내년도 활황 # Bull Run to Continue Next Year#
artcl_titl_en: 증시 내년도 활황 # Bull Run to Continue Next Year#

artcl_ctt:
? The International Monetary Fund says Korea has succeeded in overcoming its economic troubles.
? The remarks come after the I-M-F''s annual review of the Korean economy.
The agency also welcomed Seoul''s recent decision... to forego the latest batch of emergency loans.
Earlier this month... the local government decided it wasn''t necessary to receive the money... in light of the country''s foreign currency reserves.
An I-M-F official says Korea has graduated from the agency''s bailout program... at least in terms of liquidity.
However, he stressed the importance of continued reforms... pointing to the embattled Daewoo Group... and the need to improve the financial soundness of investment trust firms.?
artcl_titl: 한국 IMF 극복#IMF says Korea has overcome crisis#
artcl_titl_en: 한국 IMF 극복#IMF says Korea has overcome crisis#

artcl_ctt:
? And from the International Monetary Fund... a nod of approval for Korea''s performance last year.
The I-M-F says... Korea has succeeded in overcoming its economic troubles.
? The remarks came after the I-M-F''s annual review of the local economy with the government.
An I-M-F official even added that Korea has graduated from the agency''s bailout program... in terms of liquidity.
But... he warned against complacency... and called for continued reforms... citing as one example... the need to improve the financial soundness at investment trust firms.?
artcl_titl: KTW IMF Says Korea Has Overcome Crisis
artcl_titl_en: KTW IMF Says Korea Has Overcome Crisis

artcl_ctt:
? Amid such Y2K worries... a growing number of airlines are cancelling their flights... scheduled for today and tomorrow.
Korean Air has so far called off 35... including those to New York and Sydney.
? Asiana has yet to cancel any... but has re-scheduled 16.
Meanwhile... Bangkok''s International Airport is seeing 105 flight cancellations over this New Year''s...
Local airport authorities say 24 global carriers won''t be flying into the Thai capital for the next two days.
And with airliners stepping up their security checks... delays seem unavoidable as well.?
artcl_titl: 연말연시 방콕행 비행기 105편 취소#Flight cancellations over New Year#
artcl_titl_en: 연말연시 방콕행 비행기 105편 취소#Flight cancellations over New Year#

artcl_ctt:
?Korea''s Home Affairs Ministry today set up its Y2K situation center.
The center is divided into 5 teams including general control and internet-related ? management.
The 15-member task force will be put on 24-hour duty starting tomorrow until January third.
The ministry says the center is for extra precaution and added it has finished preparations to counter possible computer glitches.?
artcl_titl: 행자부, y2k 비상 대책 상황실-35"#Homes Affairs Ministry-Y2K Task Team#
artcl_titl_en: 행자부, y2k 비상 대책 상황실-35"#Homes Affairs Ministry-Y2K Task Team#

artcl_ctt:
?
? The recovering economy and a decline in the forex rate... are being cited as reasons for a 25-percent jump in per-capita Gross National Income.

? The IMF says Korea is over its liquidity troubles... but warns corporate and financial restructuring must continue.

? And... a Y2K-triggered failure causes frustrating delays for thousands of retailers and credit card users across Britain.?

? Hope you''re enjoying this second last day of 19-99.  Welcome to Arirang News... for Thursday, December the 30th.
Some positive news about the economy to start this hour with... ?

? For those of us in Korea... New Year''s Eve looks to start out mostly cloudy... with some rain or snow in places.
But the afternoon should be fairly dry and sunny.
Here now is a closer look at the weather here tomorrow... and elsewhere in the world. 
?

? Separatists rebels in Indonesia celebrated the 24th anniversary of the their struggle for independence on  Monday in the Aceh province of Jeunib.
Rebels of the Free Aceh Movement want complete independence from Indonesia, claiming the Indonesian government is exploiting the region''s resources.
The celebrations were largely peaceful, but there was some isolated violence.
Villagers say a motorcyclist was gunned down by security forces on Sunday.
While police say rebels shot and killed one officer and injured another in the northern end of the province.
In the last decade, at least 55-hundred people have died in the war for independence.

Good afternoon, I'm Daniel Choy.
Welcome to our newscast. 
Let's begin with our top story.

? Now to the political front.
The rival camps are finetuning their differences over the details of the proposed ruling-opposition summit.
That''s scheduled to take place sometime next week... but key issues need to be worked out... including WHO should attend the talks.
More in this report.

? The ruling and opposition may have agreed to hold the summit talk between President Kim Dae-jung and Lee Hoi-chang... but two key issues remain the sticking point.
According to an informed source at the National Congress for New Politics... the ruling party wants to include Park Tae-jun... President of its coalition partner the United Liberal Democrats in the meeting.
The NCNP is also demanding that opposition Grand National Party lawmaker Chung Hyung-keun appear at the prosecution for questioning and apologize for his slanderous remarks against President Kim.
The GNP is suggesting Chung offer his apology on the National Assembly floor without appearing at the prosecution.
Chung had called President Kim a "partisan"... a person who sided with the North during the Korean War.
Regarding the ruling party''s insistance on a three-way talk... including Park Tae-jun... the GNP is against the idea... saying the summit talk should be between President Kim and its leader only.
The political summit has been talked about for weeks but was put off as the two sides were unable to narrow their differences.
The turnaround came this week when Lee proposed a meeting with no strings attached.?
artcl_titl: #Ruling, Opposition Parties Working on Details to Summit#
artcl_titl_en: #Ruling, Opposition Parties Working on Details to Summit#

artcl_ctt:
? Welcome to Arirang News.
Here are some of the stories coming up in this edition...

? The International Monetary Fund says Korea is near graduating from its emergency bailout program ....

? Korea''s men''s volleyball team celebrates its fifth appearance at the Olympics ...

And,
? Still reeling from the weekend''s killer storms... France announces 60 regions as being hit by natural disasters.?

? Before we go... a quick reminder for our Korean viewers...
All financial institutions will be closed between tomorrow and the third day of the new month.
? Hope you''ve taken care of all your banking needs.
Well... that''s all from us this Thursday.  Thanks for watching.  Have a good night.?

? And before we go, a reminder that financial institutions in Korea will close for the new year holidays, starting tomorrow the 31st.... through to January 3rd.
The longer break is to prepare for any Y2K problems.
All other sectors, like government and business offices will remain open as usual, on the 31st and 3rd.

And with that, we come to the end of our report.
For all of us here, thanks for watching.?
? Hello and welcome to Biz.Today.?

Part II.  Light of Life, Fireworks Festival

Birth of the Millennium Baby

Live Internet Broadcast from 50 Hospitals Nationwide

Declaration of Peace

Winners of the Nobel Peace Prize

Midnight Sun

Eye of the Millennium

(scroll) The world''s first-ever display of TV cards by 500 army commandos with 500 15-inch TFT-LCD''s.

Millennial Birthday Party

Tower of Life

(scroll) The Tower of Life consists of 2000 slabs of Siru rice cake, made with rice from across Korea.
2000 people, born on January 1st, have been invited to this birthday celebration.

Birthday Fireworks

? Once again... the sights and sounds that we''re bringing to you right now... are from downtown Seoul... in particular, the 광화문 area... where the local time''s just gone past __(time)__.

? This particular segment of Korea''s millennial celebrations... are being broadcast to other countries around the world as well.
The gala event is said to be the largest-ever to take place on the Korean Peninsula... with more than a hundred-thousand performers... and a million citizens taking part.

? We mentioned earlier... there was a torch lighting ceremony at 5 p-m today (or yesterday) on 변산반도... and that there will be another one at around 7-20 tomorrow (or this) morning on Tokdo.
These torches will join a third torch... lit on the South Pacific island of Fiji... by the WORLD''s first sunlight of the new millennium.
All of them will then be taken to Korea''s southeastern port city of 포항... where the city''s own torch will be lit as soon as the first sun of the year comes up.

? There... the four torches will come together to form the Torch of Eternity... which is to be housed in the Millennium Gate.
That''s one of the Twelve Gates of Peace that are currently under construction... and will be completed in the year 2002.
And as the name says... the Torch of Eternity will forever symbolize peace... and provide light for other torches in international events.

? Now... the Presidential Commission for the New Millennium has been very secretive about some of the events planned for tonight.
The so-called X-File events include things like... a live Internet broadcast of the birth of the millennium baby... and the Seoul Peace Declaration by our very own President Kim Dae-jung and 4 Nobel Peace Prize laureates... including former Polish President Lech Walesa.

? The visit to Earth by galaxy ambassadors that we''re about to see (or we saw)... was also kept under wraps until the last minute.
And there are many more surprises that are to be unveiled during the second half of the 광화문 celebrations... that half beginning at the strike of midnight and the customary tolling of the Poshingak bell.?

? US stocks had a busy first trading day of the week.
Blue chips rallied... ?on hopes the election news out of Florida will bring closure to almost four weeks of indecision.
?The Dow Jones industrial average jumped more than 186-points... closing at 10-thousand-560.
However, tech shares didn''t fare as well.
Investors focused their attention on falling corporate earnings... dragging the Nasdaq Composite down almost 30-points... to 26-15.
Meanwhile... the broader Standard-and-Poor''s 500 edged up 10-points... to 13-25.?
Leading the gains... retailer Wal-Mart... and pharmaceuticals like Pfizer and Johnson-and-Johnson... companies which are considered safer buys in the bearish market.?

? It certainly was a grand way to usher in the new millennium... wasn''t it, Chulho?

? It sure was, Junghyun.  And the celebrations aren''t quite over yet.  After the birthday party that we just saw... there will be what we Koreans call the 고풀이 dance.

? Keeping in line with tonight''s overall theme of ''peace''... the dance will be a sort of prayer for world peace.
The perfomers will include about a hundred foreign dignitaries, tourists, workers and businessmen.

? They''ll be holding the hems of 188 long strips of cloth... tied to a pole at the center... which they''ll be dancing around.
Each strip representing each country in the world... with its own national flag and the word ''peace'' written in the native language.

? That''s sure to be quite a spectacle as well.  And that''s still not the end of these millennial celebrations.
The party will go on in the 광화문 area for another hour or so.
Might be worth checking out... if you happen to be in the neighborhood...
If only to get a closer look at the grand celebrations going on in Seoul.

? Even if you can''t... we certainly hope you''re finding your own ways to celebrate the dawning of the new millennium.
From all of us here in the news team, though... that''s all we have for you tonight.
But do stay tuned to a special performance coming up right after this.

? The program''s titled "Kim Mae-ja''s Dance: the Eye of Heaven"... and it''s something that we''ve prepared for this once-in-a-thousand-year occasion. So enjoy!

?  We''ll say our goodbyes now...
Thanks for watching Arirang News... and our special "2000 Live Coverage: Into the New Millennium."

?	 As we say in Korean...
?
?
 새해 복 많이 받으세요.?

? The International Monetary Fund says Korea has succeeded in overcoming its economic troubles... at least in terms of liquidity.
The pat on the shoulder comes after the world lending body''s annual review of the Korean economy...
But there are some challenges that still lie ahead.

? When it comes to financing, the IMF declares Korea has graduated from its rescue program.
Stanley Fischer, first deputy managing director at the IMF, is said to have made the comments to a senior government official in Washington.
But even so, Fischer said the IMF will continue to hold policy consultations with Seoul until the end of next year.
That''s part of the 19-97 bailout agreement, when Korea received a record amount of emergency loans.
But with ample foreign currency reserves in its coffers now.... Korea has decided to forego the latest batch of loans, worth one and a half billion dollars.
It''s decision that''s been welcomed by the IMF.
However, top officials at the international lending body are still urging "forceful action" be taken to strengthen Korea''s financial sector.
The investment trust industry in particular, was cited as an area needing immediate reforms.
And as the collapse of the nation''s second largest group Daewoo showed... corporate restructuring remains an urgent issue.
While commending the recent sale of Korea First Bank.... IMF officials said, more needs to be done to privatise Seoul Bank.?
artcl_titl: IMF-Korea # IMF Declares Korea Graduation from Reform Program #
artcl_titl_en: IMF-Korea # IMF Declares Korea Graduation from Reform Program #

artcl_ctt:
? Koreans travelling to Shanghai, China for less than 2 days... ? won''t be needing a visa from next year.
The Shanghai People''s Government says the 48-hour visa waiver applies to citizens of 17 countries...
They include Korea, the United States, Canada, Australia, New Zealand, Japan and several European countries.
The Shanghai Daily says, though... British nationals have been excluded... for which Chinese authorities declined to give a reason.?
artcl_titl: Shanghai no-visa #Shanghai to offer visa waiver to Koreans from next year#
artcl_titl_en: Shanghai no-visa #Shanghai to offer visa waiver to Koreans from next year#

INFLATION RATE TURNABOUT

Seoul''s Finance-Economy Ministry says Korea will end 1999 with the lowest inflation rate in more than three decades.
-------------------------------
GROSS NATIONAL INCOME

The recovering economy and falling forex rate are being linked to a 25% jump in the per capita Gross National Income.
-------------------------------
Y2K IN THE UK

Thousands of retailers and credit card users in Great Britain experience delays, caused by a Y2K-triggered failure.
-------------------------------
OUT OF THE WOODS

The International Monetary Fund says Korea is over its liquidity troubles, but warns corporate and financial restructuring must continue.

?
?Reports of Y2k-related glitches in parts of the world... have people turning a nervous eye to the New Year''s Eve countdown.

?Korea''s expected to end 1999 with the lowest inflation rate in more than three decades.

?And... the recovering economy and falling forex rate are being linked to a 25% jump in the per capita GNI.?

? Another popular attraction in time for the new millennium is turning out to be the Pyramids of Mexico.
Here''s a look at the area... which was once the seventh largest city in the ancient world.

? Teotihuacan is the city where the first people arrived from the Gulf of Mexico...approximately two hundred years before Christ.
At its height it used to be a thriving city...with a population of over 200 thousand people.
Much of what is known about the ancient city comes from the extensive murals and carvings found in the city ruins.
Its influence can also be seen in other parts of Mexico and Central America.
Yet litte is known about the place like what language they spoke and why the city was completely abandoned.
That is why an air of mystery hangs over the place and people...especially in time of the millenium are flocking in to visit the site.
?"It''s the biggest meso-american city that exists in archaeological terms. What makes it so interesting is that we don''t know why it was abandoned. If we continue making bombs, atomic bombs, we are going to follow them. In the millennium I hope there will be no more war, no more bombs."
The millenium celebration...planned for December 31 will stage reenactments of some of the ancestral rites and customs of the Teotihuacan people.?

?Welcome to Arirang News.
I''m Ahn Junghyun in Seoul.
?And I''m Hyun Chulho.
Thanks for being with us.?

?Industrial output posted 26-point-8 percent in November this year...with the increase in auto exports, computers and accounting equipment....and a general ?rise in domestic demand.
In a monthly report on the countries industrial activities...the National Statistical Office said...consumer goods shipments for domestic use rose 23-point-1 percent due to continued demand in mobile phones and autos.
On the investment front...machinery shipments for domestic use jumped year to year by 51-point-9 percent...while machine imports climbed 54 percent.
Facility investment also skyrocketed 66-point-2 percent...the highest figure since 19-96.?

? The nation''s major conglomerates say they will continue restructuring at their own pace next year.
? In an interview with a local wire service... Hyundai''s Chung Mong-koo said his company will concentrate on five core businesses... including electronics, heavy industries, and construction.
The Group also plans to improve its financial structure by further boosting its debt-to-equity ratio and attracting foreign investments.
Meanwhile, Samsung Chairman Lee Kun-hee said his company will concentrate on high technology along with plans to introduce various innovative compensation programs to secure a professional workforce.
LG... for its part... plans to bring in foreign equity into LG subsidiaries... and focus on biotechnology, information and communications, as well as electronics.?

? All the benefits of acupuncture without the pain.
That''s what a new device called ''Acutreat'' promises.
? The handy, electronic device has an integrated I-C circuit board... which makes treatment of everyday ailments such as indigestion, headaches, and rheumatism safe and quick.
Acutreat has won approval from the US Food and Drug Administration.
The makers say the device is safe to use on children and the elderly, has no side effects, and is simple to use.
It can also be adjusted for individual needs.?

? Sejong Hotel, Millennium Eve Special Event

Sejong Hotel coffee shop is offering a special millennium menu around midnight December 31st... 
For just 10,000 won you can get a set menu that includes rice cakes and freshly baked cookies, served with beer.
And those staying at the hotel will be free of charge, so don''t miss the opportunity.
Free wine or champagne will be served for those who order a meal... and free beer comes along with the side dishes.
At Firenze, customers can have there photos taken... or they can try their luck with the hotel lottery.
If luck has it, you could get to stay overnight at one of the luxurious rooms of Sejong Hotel, win free meals at the hotel''s buffet restaurant, take home a millennium cake, or gain free access to the saunas.

? The National Information Service published a photo collection which gives a vivid image of Korea during the post war period.
? A second of its kind... the photobook covers historical events, government functions and the lives of ordinary people between 1954 to 1956. 
The first photo collection, published back in May...
features all the important events that occurred during 1948 to 1953... including the founding of the country and the Korean War.
Boosted by the strong public interest... the government says it will publish another series of photo collections in the near future.?

? We''ve reported before on a pan-national 
?hand-holding movement that is being pushed by the Korean National Council of Churches, the Chogye Buddhist sect... and other religious groups in Korea.
Today the organizers held an appointment ceremony for its promotion committee.
The committee comprises leaders of various religious faiths, T-V celebrities, lawmakers and other notable figures of the society.
Afterwards the key organizers and promoters moved to Seoul station where they pitched calls for national unity and reconciliation.
They handed out leaflets for people to take part in the show of national unity.
Korean residents abroad are also scheduled to join a march or join hands on March first at three P-M next year.
The KNCC says work is underway with North Korea... to have citizens link hands... all the way from the truce village of Panmunjom to Seoul and cities in the provinces.?

? And people''s spending power went up around 25 percent this year... with the economy on the recovery mode.
Seoul''s estimating per-capita Gross National Income... at eight and-a-half thousand US dollars.
Park Jonghong reports.

? The estimated per capita Gross National Income of 8,500 dollars took into account three factors.
They are the annual economic growth of 10 percent, the average won-dollar exchange rate of 1,189 won and the average annual consumer price increase of 0-point-8 percent.
The Finance-Economy Ministry says the estimated per? capita G-N-I is up 24-point-6 percent from the previous year.?
A ministry official says the margin of difference between the G-N-I and Gross Domestic Product is not significant since the G-N-I is calculated by taking into account export-import unit prices and other trade indices including the G-D-P.
Per capita G-N-I surpassed 10 thousand dollars for the? first time in 19-95 and climbed to over 11 thousand the following year.
In 19-98, the figure plunged to the 6,000 dollar level in the wake of the won''s plunge against the dollar following the I-M-F bailout.?
?The ministry says, in the year 2000, the per capita G-N-I is expected to hit 11,000 dollars.? 
This is Park Jonghong Arirang TV.?
artcl_titl: GNI for 1999#Gross National Income this year#
artcl_titl_en: GNI for 1999#Gross National Income this year#

? In the year 2000, the government is planning to revise its tax agreements with Australia, Germany, and? Mexico.
Meanwhile it will push to sign new tax agreements with.... Chile, Colombia, Jordan, Myanmar, and Croatia.
Korea currently has tax pacts with 52 countries and it''s hoped the new initiatives will expand economic and personnel exchange.
The tax agreements prevent double taxation on individuals and firms doing business overseas.?

? In the U-S, lawyers for major tobacco companies ? are asking a federal judge to dismiss a Justice Department lawsuit that seeks billions of dollars in healthcare costs to treat smoke-related illnesses.
The tobacco firms are arguing the U-S government has no basis to recover Medicare and other health costs.
Industry lawyers say the Justice Department is ignoring settlements made by tobacco companies... in which cigarette makers agreed to pay states 246-billion dollars to settle lawsuits filed to recover the cost of treating sick smokers.
The government alleges that tobacco firms conspired for decades to defraud and mislead the public about the dangers of smoking.?

artcl_titl_en: 미 필립모리스#Tobacco companies try to get suit dismissed#

artcl_ctt:
The first phase of the plan is to link the people of Mokpo to those in Taejon, from Pusan to Taejon, and from Seoul to the truce village of Panmunjom.
The effort is forecast to require 1 million to 1.5 million people.
I think the grand hand-holding movement will be possible since the religious leaders in this country, rekindling the spirit of the March 1st Independence Movement, have made a plea to the people for their participation.
The second phase, although it is difficult, intends to link Panmunjom to Shinuiju in North Korea.
We have made a formal proposal to religious leaders in the North and we hope they will come forth for negotiations as soon as possible.
Furthermore, for our efforts of national reconciliation and reunification, we have appointed Hyundai''s honorary chairman Chung Ju-young as our special ambassador.
Chung of course is the man who has developed the Mount Kumkang Tour with North Korea and recently paved the way for the visit of North Korean basketball players to Seoul.
So with his cooperation, I believe the second phase may also take place.
We have also made a request to ethnic Koreans living overseas to voluntarily join hands at 3 PM on March first.
That would promote the movement beyond the two Koreas and to the world as an event uniting all the Korean people.//////



As all of you would recall, the March 1st Movement 80 years ago was a peaceful movement initiated by religious leaders during the hardships under Japanese colonial rule.
The movement amazed the world through its methods of non-violence and non-protest.
With the beginning of the new millennium and on the 81st anniversary of the March 1st Independence Movement, we wish all the Korean people, wherever they are at that time, to prepare for and participate in the hand-holding movement toward reconciliation and peace.
This movement will wipe away the fears among the world''s people about the fears of another war on the Korean Peninsula, the only divided country in the world.
I hope the Korean people will voluntarily take part in this movement.?

? Civil service may be a career worth considering...
The government says it''s recruiting 76 percent more in the coming year.
3,600 positions will be filled through open tests... ? given by the Government Administration and Home Affairs Ministry.
Of the total... 273 will be picked through state exams for administration, foreign affairs and technology.
Meanwhile, the number of entry-level, grade-nine officials... will be doubled... to about 29-hundred... whereas the quota for grade-seven civil servants will go down to 442.?

? The Bank of Korea forecasts this year''s current account surplus will hit 26-billion dollars.
? As of the end of November, the  surplus was at 23-point-5 billion dollars.
However the central bank predicts that next year... the surplus will shrink by more than half...to just over 11-billion dollars.
The bank expects a fall in the goods surplus from this year''s projected 30-billion.... to around 16-billion in the year 2000.
On a customs-cleared basis... Korean exports surged 21-point-5 percent from a year ago.
That''s another high year-on-year growth rate of over 20-percent... while imports soared 40-percent compared to the same period last year.?

? Israel will reportedly give the Palestinian Authority... civilian control in parts of northern Jersusalem.
? Haaretz daily says... Israel conveyed this willingness to the Palestinians... during recent talks on drawing up a peace deal.
Officials explain the Israeli government is not giving up sovereignty in the Arab neighborhoods of Beit Hanina and Shuafat.
But... under the move... every day responsibilities in the areas will be transferred to the Palestinian Authority.
The arrangement is in line with the two countries efforts to conclude peace talks next year.?

? Ssangyong Motor is aiming to boost its sales by 42-percent next year... selling 140-thousand cars worth 2-trillion won.
? To that end... the company plans to introduce a number of new models... including the four-wheel drive Y-2000... as well as new versions of the sports utility vehicles Musso and Korando... and the luxury sedan Chairman.
The automaker expects domestic sales to rise 20-percent from this year... to 97-thousand units... and exports... 143-percent to 43-thousand units.
The company also says it expects to stay completely independent from its parent Daewoo Group.?

? Over in the United States.
Increasing fears of terrorist attacks over the new year holidays... have prompted the city of Seattle to cancel a gala event.
? The city''s Space Needle was expected to attract 50-thousand people with its grand fireworks display.
The fireworks will go ahead... but the public will be barred from the site.
While assuring people that there is no specific threat against the city... Mayor Paul Schell cited the recent arrest of Ahmed Ressam... caught near Seattle... trying to smuggle bomb-making materials into the U-S.
The Algerian native reportedly had a motel room booked near the Space Needle on New Year''s eve.
?

? U-S veterans confirm there were other incidents during the Korean War... when the American Air Force killed scores of innocent civilians.
? Washington''s declassified documents also support Koreans'' claims that American bombers were responsible for the deaths of hundreds of unarmed refugees.
Veteran pilots say US commanders feared enemy soldiers were hiding among the refugees... and so authorized the attacks.
Such a move goes against international laws... like the Geneva Convention... which forbid the targeting of non-combatants during conflict.
Korean and US officials are currently investigating a similar incident that took place at Nogunri... where hundreds of civilians were apparently gunned down by American soldiers, fifty years ago.?
artcl_titl: AP, 만행 새 증거 발견# New Atrocities of US Troops During Korean War #
