artcl_ctt:
? Former US airmen confirm... there were mass killings of unarmed civilians during the Korean War.
They say... US commanders, fearing enemy soldiers were hiding among the refugees... authorized the air raids.
More in this report.

? U-S veterans confirm there were other fatal incidents during the Korean War... when the American Air Force killed scores of innocent civilians.
And formerly secret U-S Air Force mission reports show... how attacks by American jets left many Koreans in civilian clothes dead.
The declassified papers describe attacks on people in white clothes... who appeared to have been evacuees... or refugees.
During the war... thousands of refugees in typical white clothing... were forced out of their homes and villages... and onto roadways and bridges.
Veteran pilots say U-S commanders on the ground feared enemy soldiers were hiding among the refugees to flee the fighting.
? "Twice we were directed to strafe these people who were dressed like civilians. 
Now whether they were or not we have no way of knowing."
Such a move goes against international laws... like the Geneva Convention... which forbids the targeting of non-combatants during conflict.
? "I don''t think anyone wanted to go out and kill civilians, kill refugees in particular.
I guess we did it a time or two, maybe other outfits did the same."
Korean and U-S officials are currently investigating a similar incident that took place at Nogunri... where hundreds of civilians were apparently gunned down by American soldiers, fifty years ago.?
artcl_titl: "미 공군, 한국전 민간인 폭격"#Another Civilian Killing by U-S Troops during Korean War"
artcl_titl_en: "미 공군, 한국전 민간인 폭격"#Another Civilian Killing by U-S Troops during Korean War"

artcl_ctt:
? Vast improvements are on the horizon for the broadcasting industry... with the onset of the digital era.
For the general public... this means... better TV sound and picture quality... as well as more channels.
The changes are in line with the controversial broadcasting law... which took five years to clear the National Assembly.

? The bill was passed after the ruling and opposition camps agreed on a compromise.
They agreed to cancel a one-year prison term for broadcasting employees found guilty of leaking confidential information.
Instead, the fine was raised.
Now that the legal ground has been set for digital and satellite broadcasting... the number of TV channels.... will double, if not triple in the near future.
Korea currently has around 30 channels... including cable and terrestrial channels.
But with conglomerates, foreign and press companies allowed in the satellite broadcasing industry... that number is expected to swell... to 60, maybe even eighty.
The year 2001 is going to see the beginning of full-fledged digital broadcasting ... offering  viewers theater-like sound and picture quality right in their living rooms.
Special TV sets and equipment needed for digital broadcasting ... is expected to generate 7 trillion won in production... and 60-thousand jobs.
Observers also hope the Korean Broadcasting Committee... responsible for drawing up and carrying out related policies and licensing... will ensure more fair, and independent broadcasting.?

artcl_titl: 대형 화물차 고속도로 심야 통행료 할인
artcl_titl_en: 대형 화물차 고속도로 심야 통행료 할인

artcl_ctt:
THIS YEAR HAS BEEN THE TURNING POINT  OF THE CENTURY AS WELL AS THE TURNING  POINT  FOR A   NEW AGE IN   ASIAN POLITICS.   WE HAVE 
EXPERIENCED MANY TURNING  POINTS IN THE  CONTINUING COLD WAR  ON THE KOREAN PENINSULA AS  WELL AS IN  THE HISTORICAL RELATIONS  OF KOREA, CHINA, AND  JAPAN.  A  GREAT WAVE OF  DEMOCRATIZATION HAS SWEPT THE  WORLD  IN  WHICH  ELECTIONS  HAVE BECOME  A   GLOBAL PHENOMENON AS WITNESSED  RECENTLY IN  INDONESIA.  FINALLY,  KOREA HAS PROUDLY BECOME A WORLD PLAYER, IN JOINING THE FORCES IN  EAST TIMOR TO BRING PEACE AND  STABILITY TO RAVAGED LAND.   TODAY, WE ARE HERE TO EXAMINE  THE FORCES OF  CHANGE AND HOW  THE EVENTS 
THIS YEAR WILL  SHAPE THE  COURSE OF ASIA''S  HISTORY FOR  THE NEW MILLENNIUM.

THE  TWENTIETH   CENTURY IN   ASIA   HAS BEEN   MARKED  BY   MUCH UPHEAVAL: FROM IMPERIALISM  TO COMMUNISM  TO GLOBAL  CAPITALISM.   AS WE  STOW AWAY  THE ECONOMIC  CRISIS BEHIND  US, WE  ARE FACED 
WITH MANY  NEW CHALLENGES  AS WE  LIVE IN  OUR OWN  COMMUNITIES AND AT THE SAME TIME,  IN THE WORLD AT LARGE.   FROM THE PAINFUL 
PAST TO  BOLD NEW  BEGINNINGS, THE  SUN WILL  ALWAYS RISE   IN THE EAST.  HAPPY NEW MILLENNIUM, EVERYONE.

?Also in 1999... this time on the sports scene.
There were a number of Korean athletes... who took their talents onto playing fields around the world.
And they turned more than a fair share of heads... with their kicks... swings... and pitches.
Kim Boram reports.

? 1999 marked the end of a legend and the start for some rising young stars on the international sports scene.
First, let''s start with international Soccer where the Korean National team qualified for the 2000 Sydney Olympics with wins over Bahrain and China.
The National team continues to prepare for the 2002 World Cup in Korea and Japan, finishing the year with a record of 19 wins, 3 losses and 5 ties.
Leading scorer for the team was Lee Dong-gook  with 12 goals.
19-98 US Women''s amateur champion Grace Park won the 1999 NCAA individual championship and placed third at the Safeway LPGA Championship.
She led the field in driving as an amateur at the US Women''s Open with a 263.4 yard average.
Expect to see her debut as a pro in the year 2000.
Kim Mi-hyun, this year''s LPGA Rookie of the Year, finished eighth on the tour money list.
She took home the Betsy King Classic and Rail Classic finishing the year with eleven top-ten finshes.
1998 Rookie of the Year, Park Se-ri, finished third on this year''s money-list.
She had four victories in 99 including the Tour Championship, which she won in a three-way sudden death playoff against Karrie Webb and Laura Davies.
And to the world of Baseball, where the Major Leagues now have three Korean pitchers.
Rookie Kim Byung-hyun debuted with the Arizona Diamondbacks and Boston Red Sox pitcher Cho Jin-ho are both future prospects to watch.
Meanwhile, Los Angeles Dodgers starter Park Chan-ho finished the year strong after a mid-season slump with a 13 and 11 record.
And finally, Korea''s pitching legend Sun Dong-yul decided it was time to retire.
Sun began his illustrious career with the Hatai Tigers back in 19-85, leading them to six Korean series titles over 11 years.
He finished his career in Japan with the Chunichi Dragons where he helped the team to a penant and a trip to the Japanese Series earlier this year.
With his career record standing at 146 wins, 40 losses and 132 saves... Sun is unquestionably the greatest pitcher ever in Korea.?

? Turning now to the business world.
Latest calculations show... the Korean economy... in this new year... will continue to charge ahead at a faster rate than predicted earlier.
And so to reflect such improved optimism... the Seoul government is making some last-minute changes to its projections... soon to be officially released.

? The Gross Domestic Product is forecast to grow by around six percent in the year 2000.
Earlier estimates by the Ministry of Finance and Economy... had put the growth rate lower... somewhere between five and six percent.
The rise in consumer prices is likely to be lower than initial expectations... staying in the two percent range.
Authorities also have a rosier outlook for the nation''s current account surplus...
with that figure forecast to exceed 12-billion dollars.
And prospects are looking brighter in the job market...
with the unemployment rate expected to fall to four and a half percent.
That''s two percent less than the average posted for 19-99.
Korea will also have to deal with a lighter foreign debt burden compared to last year...
As of the end of October in ''99 ... Seoul owed 136 billion dollars to overseas lenders...
That number is forecast to fall to 120 billion.
As for the reasons behind the revisions...
a ministry official points to improved prospects for exports... due to the rebounding Asian economy and the soaring  value of the Japanese yen.
The revised outlook reflects the government''s economic plans for the year 2000... which the ministry will unveil early this month.
Under the blueprint... authorities will also continue building up the nation''s foreign currency reserves.
As of December 15th... there was 72-point-7 billion dollars in reserves...
That is likely to go up to 90-billion this year.?

artcl_titl: 국민 대화합 차원 백만명에 재기의 기회..DJ 담화
artcl_titl_en: 국민 대화합 차원 백만명에 재기의 기회..DJ 담화

artcl_ctt:
? And that is our report for this Wednesday evening.
? Thank you for watching and we''ll see you back here tomorrow.?

? Korea''s film industry had much to celebrate in 19-99.
The famous spy movie ''Swiri'' not only set records at home... but also enjoyed great ticket sales abroad.
There were also shorter films... which received recognitions internationally.
And as Ahn Chak-hee now tells us... the successes couldn''t have come at a better time.

? A star-studded group of demonstrators took to the streets of Seoul in January 1999.
They were protesting Washington''s pressure on Seoul to do away with the screen quota system... which requires theatres to set aside 106 days for Korean movies each year.
Heeding such action, Seoul promised to keep the quota intact... until the domestic film industry gains a bigger audience.
Well... that time may have come sooner than expected.
The Korean movie industry posted a record performance last year with its market share reaching 40 percent.
?? "One example of the phenomenal success is the action thriller ''Swiri'' which nearly one seventh of the entire population has seen."? 
Annual events like the Pusan International and the Puchon International Fantastic film festivals played a key role... but it was more than just exposure that spurred the growth.
? "I think the major reasons are there was a professional producing system and also marketing strategy and also screen quota system."?	
Another development in 1999 was phase-two of opening the local market to Japanese cultural products... after initial liberalization in 1998.
Although Japanese music, films, and animation did not create much of a following last year... many industry watchers say this year may be another story.
And to provide a way for Korea''s cultural industry to nurture its own identity and move on in the new millennium... the government has... for the first time in its history... allocated one-percent of the national budget or the equivalent of 800-million US dollars to support it.
? "We can expect a lot of support to go to the cultural industry which included fields such as game and animation as well as the film industry."?

On another front... the National Assembly finally passed the revised Broadcasting Law... after five years of wrangling about the fine print.
1999.
All in all... it was a year when the cultural scene prepared itself for the challenges of global competition in the new millennium.
Ahn Chak-hee, Arirang TV.?

? The bill was passed after the ruling and opposition camps agreed on a compromise.
They agreed to cancel a one-year prison term for broadcasting employees found guilty of leaking confidential information.
Instead, the fine was raised.
Now that the legal ground has been set for digital and satellite broadcasting... the number of TV channels.... will double, if not triple in the near future.
Korea currently has around 30 channels... including cable and terrestrial channels.
But with conglomerates, foreign and press companies allowed in the satellite broadcasing industry... that number is expected to swell... to 60, maybe even eighty.
The year 2001 is going to see the beginning of full-fledged digital broadcasting ... offering  viewers theater-like sound and picture quality right in their living rooms.
Special TV sets and equipment needed for digital broadcasting ... is expected to generate 7 trillion won in production... and 60-thousand jobs.
Observers also hope the Korean Broadcasting Committee... responsible for drawing up and carrying out related policies and licensing... will ensure more fair, and independent broadcasting.?

? Hijackers of an Indian Airlines plane stepped up their demands... in return for the 155 hostages.
? Now... they want the release of 35 Muslim militants, the coffin of a terrorist, buried in India... and 200 million dollars in cash.
Initially, the hijackers just sought freedom for a jailed Pakistani Muslim cleric and some Kashimiri fighters.
As negotiations continue... the Indian government says it''ll come up with an appropriate response to the demands.
Meantime, concerns are rising about the conditions on board the jet parked in Afghanistan... as the standoff enters its sixth day.
Taliban soldiers who have delivered food to the plane describe the smell inside as strong and unpleasant.?

artcl_ctt:
? A much talked ? about political summit... between the heads of rival camps... has yet to materialize.
But things are moving in that direction... with the opposition leader Lee Hoi-chang proposing a summit with President Kim Dae-jung in the New Year.
Lee said this week he would meet the President... with no strings attached... in the spirit of creating a new vision for politics.
Observers say... the first days of the new year... in all its millennial symbolism... would be a possible time for the meeting to happen.
Lee said the one-on-one talks should focus on mapping out a long-term structure for national politics.?
? Hello and welcome to Arirang News for Wednesday, December 29th.?
? Now for a look at tomorrow''s weather for cities in Korea and around the world.?

artcl_ctt:
? The government has revised its GDP growth rate for next year... to six percent.
? The figure is one percentage point higher than its earlier forecast.
Seoul also predicts... next year''s inflation rate is likely to be lower than initial expectations... to stay in the two percent range.
Authorities also believe the current account surplus will exceed 12-billion dollars... while the unemployment rate will drop to four-and-a-half percent.
The revised outlook reflects the government''s economic plans for the new year... which the Ministry of Finance and Economy will unveil early next month.?
artcl_titl: 정부 내년 성장률 6%대#Gov''t forecast for 2000 economy#
artcl_titl_en: 정부 내년 성장률 6%대#Gov''t forecast for 2000 economy#

artcl_ctt:
? That is our report for this hour.
We''ll have more news coming you way later tonight.
Hope you''ll join us then.?

?Hwang Kyu-hwan, ? President of the Korea International Broadcasting Foundation... which operates Arirang TV... received an award ... from the country''s Public Relations Association.
The recognition was for his work to promote Korea to an international audience.
Since he took office... Arirang TV became Korea''s first TV channel to broadcast programs... in English... overseas via satellite.
The KPRA... was celebrating its 10th anniversary yesterday.?

YEAR-END REMARKS

President Kim, in a national address, announces a special amnesty to free a million prisoners ahead of the new millennium.
-------------------------------
GOING PRIVATE

Seoul unveils a final plan to privatize the Korea Heavy Industries & Construction Co., involving a strategic alliance with foreign firms, including GE and ABB.
-------------------------------
BETTER THAN EXPECTED

In a move reflecting optimism about next year''s economy, the government bumps up its forecast for economic growth to 6%.
-------------------------------
DEBT RELIEF

Six life insurance firms, set to be taken over by healthier ones, receive W1.9 trillion ($1.6 billion) in public funds, to cover debts which exceed assets.

?
?President Kim, in a national address, announces a special amnesty to benefit a million people.

?Seoul unveils a final blueprint to private Korea Heavy Industries and Construction.

?And the government bumps up its forecast for next year''s economic growth rate to 6%.?

?Official numbers won''t be out till next month.
But in a move reflecting its optimism about next year''s economy... Seoul has bumped up its economic growth rate forecast.
More in this report.

? The Gross Domestic Product is forecast to grow by around six percent next year.
Earlier estimates by the Ministry of Finance and Economy... had put the growth rate lower... somewhere between five and six percent.
The rise in consumer prices is likely to be lower than initial expectations... staying in the two percent range.
Authorities also have a rosier outlook for the nation''s current account surplus...
with that figure forecast to exceed 12-billion dollars.
And prospects are looking brighter in the job market...
with the unemployment rate expected to fall to four and a half percent.
That''s two percent less than the average posted for 19-99.
Korea will also have to deal with a lighter foreign debt burden compared to this year...
As of the end of October... Seoul owed 136 billion dollars to overseas lenders...
That number is forecast to fall to 120 billion.
As for the reasons behind the revisions...
An official with the Finance Economy Ministry points to improved prospects for exports... due to the rebounding Asian economy and the soaring  value of the Japanese yen.
The revised outlook reflects the government''s economic plans for the year 2000... which the Ministry of Finance and Economy will unveil early next month.
Under the blueprint... authorities will also continue building up the nation''s foreign currency reserves.
As of December 15th... there was 72-point-7 billion dollars in reserves...
That is likely to go up to 90-billion in the coming year.?

? That''s our report for this Wednesday morning December 29th.
We hope you''ll stay with Arirang TV for all the latest stories...
Thank you as always, for watching!?

artcl_titl_en: AP,미군 민간인 폭격 새로운 증거 찾았다

artcl_ctt:
? With the clock fast ticking away towards the year two thousand... governments and businesses around the world are preparing for possible Y2K-related problems.
Here''s a look at some of the precautionary measures being taken in other countries.

? There are only three days remaining before the year 2000 rollover... and everyone is preparing for possible disruptions caused by the Y2K computer glitch.
In Japan, the government has ordered 100-thousand police to be on a special nationwide alert.
Down under in Australia... authorities are bracing themselves for throngs of tourists who are expected to visit during the millennium celebrations.
The number of police officers has been increased at major tourist attractions... to cope with large crowds.
In the Philippines, government officials have assigned special task forces to be on the lookout for possible terrorist attacks at airports and other transportation hubs.
Meanwhile in Hong Kong, two dozen airlines have canceled at least 210-flights coming in and going out of Hong Kong... because there are fewer people wanting to fly during the New Year.
Hong Kong''s main carrier, Cathay Pacific will scrap 78-flights... that''s 18-percent of its total schedule during that period.
In the U-S... the presidential Y2K advisor says he doesn''t expect any major disasters resulting from computer malfunctions.
According to John Koskinen, the White House Y2K troubleshooter... possible computer-related glitches affecting infrastructure like power plants or telecommunications lines... will not rise to anything significant on a national basis.
Federal and local governments, as well as private businesses have spent more than 100-billion dollars to fix or upgrade existing computer systems in the U-S.?

?Welcome to Arirang News.
I''m Ahn Chakhee in Seoul.
?And I''m Hyun Chulho.
Thanks for being with us.?

Latin America Update Tape D-4
1. US: Bush                                          01:22

2. US : Vote Ruling 3                            03:19

3. Chile : Pinochet                                 03:10

4. Russia : Flag                                     02:30

5. Florida : Ruling                                   02:30

?Over in the political ? arena.
Two separate cases of senior lawmakers... bolting from their parties.
Opposition Grand National Party adviser Lee Han-dong officially announced ... he will join the United Liberal Democrats... coalition partner of the ruling National Congress for New Politics.
Observers say Lee''s move will likely fuel efforts to form a major coalition of conservative forces.
Meanwhile... the ULD''s Kim Yong-hwan voiced his intention to leave the party... during a meeting with the Prime Minister.
The three-term lawmaker will reportedly step up work to create a new party.?

? Sejong Hotel
? First up, Sejong Hotel.  
All workers at Sejong will be working throughout new year''s eve and new years day to prepare against any mishaps that could occur from the millennium bug. 

Efforts to provide quality service and security don''t end here... employees at the computer center are working non-stop...

And there''s even a private electric generator ready to run in case the system does go down.


? WalkerHill Hotel
? WalkerHill has also been busy preparing against the Y2K bug,

And it seems they''re Y2K ready with a government-recognized certificate to prove it.

? Hyatt Hotel

? Hyatt Hotel is no exception in the busy preparations for the coming millennium...
They have enough food stock to last ten days, 

and there''s even an emergency light in every room, incase of an electricity cut-off.

? Lotte Hotel

?  Last but not least... workers of Hotel Lotte are working on a team basis to prepare against just about any possible accidents... including electricity, gas, and water stoppage.

?	 ("Does the hotel have any back-up plans in case the system does go down or malfunction?")

?
 ("The most important task for us is to keep the hotel going... to provide quality service to our guests.  
That''s why we keep a printed copy of all the files on our computer so that even if there is a breakdown, our guests don''t encounter any difficulties.")

?
 And with few foreigners willing to travel on the first day of the new year, maintaining top service for  their guests remain the key goal of hotels.

?  ("We make it a rule to keep a printed copy of our guest list, and all important data and files have been completed in case the computer goes down.")

The thorough preparations go all the way to the security division.
At Lotte, guest security remains the top priority.

That''s why security division workers hold a meeting everyday to guarantee the safety of their guests.
And these meetings are not just to prepare for the millennium... it''s a daily routine that goes on throughout the year.
On top of that, there''s the high-tech CCTV monitors that keep track of all corners of the hotel.

?
 ("We''ll have no problems whatsoever concerning security, as our private electric generator will automatically go on in case of a computer failure.")

? ("My job is to protect our guests by keeping an eye out for the suspicious.")

? Good Morning to you on this third to the last day of 19-99.
Today is Wednesday, December 29th.
Partly cloudy to clear skies are expected around the peninsula...
Checking the temperatures for you...
The morning is starting off cooler than yesterday... with lows ranging from minus six to ten degrees above zero.
It won''t get much higher than fifteen degrees today.?

? 
My honorable and beloved fellow Koreans.

The 20th century is coming to an end and a new millennium is dawning.

Today at this historic juncture, I would like to recall the lessons of the past century and renew our pledge for the new millennium of hope.

The 20th century was a truly eventful period in our history... during which we''ve experienced disgrace and glory, despair and success.

We suffered the disgrace of losing our sovereignty, but we fought and achieved independence.  Through the pains of division and fratricidal war... we defended this country from communist invasion and established the world''s 11th economic power.

Even under long years of military dictatorship and authoritarian regimes... we aspired and made sacrifices to acheive democracy... eventually enabling the first peaceful power transfer from the ruling to an opposition party.  That''s the biggest victory for democracy.

The foreign exchange crisis shattered overnight... what we''d accomplished over seceral decades... but after successfully weathering such a crisis... we''re now preparing for the new millennium with hope and confidence.

But in order for us to join the ranks of advanced nations in the coming 21st century... we can''t help but take a look at where we stand at this point of time when the 20th century is ending.
Deep-rooted regional conflict, corruption, selfishness, and political confrontation and confusion are all obstacles hindering the growth of our society.

Under these wrongs, no one on this land can be completely free.
Before we greet the new millennium... we have to seek redemption from and bid farewell to these practices and errors.
That would also be our declaration of freedom... under which we can all be reborn.

At the same time, all of us have to start a new history of forgiveness and unity.

Reconciliation and unity among regions, social classes, generations, genders, and political parties are preconditions to a new millennium of hope.

When we were united... we were able to exert enormous power.
On the other hand... when we were split... our history had to taste bitter despair and hardship.

We were able to overcome the foreign exchange crisis by combining our efforts and cooperating.
Even those that hadn''t voted for me in the presidential election and had said they would immigrate to other countries if I were elected... shared the pain and made sacrifices at the forefront of our recovery efforts... and I have not forgotten that.

National unity is what created this remarkable strength.

Above all, the ruling and opposition camps have to lead the way to reconciliation and unity.
We cannot deny that Korean politics, as it stands now... has divided public opinions through dispute and confrontation and has been the biggest hurdle to national development.

Now is the time when the ruling and opposition camps forge a partnership and open a new era of politics based on reconciliation and cooperation.
The effort that we spent on looking at the past and point out each other''s wrongs... must now be concentrated on pushing the country forward in the new millennium.

I promise I will not save my most concerted effort towards achieving this goal.
And as for the controversial events that took place in the past... they''ll be dealt with according to principles and I am willing to show leniency.

Under the spirit of national unity... I am also planning the following measures... as we bid farewell to the 20th century.

In special consideration for those in difficult circumstances... I will implement a large-scale parole and free others of probation.

For those that are under financial sanctions because of unforeseen circumstances... I will either ease or abolish their sentences and give them a second chance to take part in efforts to push the economy forward.

For those in the construction industry who are suffering administrative sanctions for illegal practices such as prearranged bidding... I will ease the sanctions so that they can renew their pledge and help to boost economic activity.

For those that have committed crimes to maintain their livelihood and are currently on the run, they will be given a chance to turn themselves in and start their lives anew.

These measures will benefit about a million Koreans.
I sincerely wish them hope and advancement in their future.

Between husbands and wives, siblings, friends, neighbors, and co-workers... if there are any hard feelings left... let us get rid of them along with the 20th century.
Let us fill the rifts created by confrontation and conflict... with reconciliation and unity.

For us Koreans who''ve weathered the past century of ups and downs and continued our 5000 year history... the beginning of the new millennium is an opportunity that we cannot miss out on.

I intend to end this century and open a new century of hope with pride and introspection... and I sincerely hope you will take part in such an effort.

I wish you good health and happiness.

Thank you.

? The Korean government will also be on special Y2K alert... keeping a close eye on what''s happening in New Zealand and Australia.
? There''s a three-hour difference between Seoul and Wellington.
According to the Y2K task force here... any problems that arise in Oceania will be reported immediately to the Korean embassies in the region.
Then... the reports will be relayed to relevant ministries and agencies.
If there is a Y2K problem with hospital equipment in Australia... the problem will be reported to medical authorities here in Korea within half an hour.?

anc_ment_ctt:
?@ Imagine leaving your ever-expanding wallet at home... and still having the convenience of using your credit cards, coupons, and membership card...
Sound too good to be true?
Well, one of Korea's biggest wireless carriers wants to lighten your load by making smartphones your new wallets.
Paul Yi has more.
artcl_ctt:
?@ Savvy consumers these days are saying goodbye to paper and plastic, in favor of their smartphones.
Here at this coffee shop, customers are able to pay for drinks, redeem digital coupons, and keep track of membership points all from one mobile device.
This example of converging technologies and services has become a booming trend in Korea, which is providing high convenience for customers and businesses alike.

(Korean)
?@?@?@ "I didn't like that my wallet was thick due to cards, receipts, and coupons. Now my wallet is thin and it's nice that I can comfortably use my smartphone."

Korea's leading corporations are racing to ensure smartphones not only compliment cash and credit, but eventually consolidate everyone's financial needs through a single mobile application.

Earlier this month, Korea's second largest cell phone carrier, KT Telecom announced a new instant mobile payment system called Mo-Ca, a combination of the words "money" and "card." 

The MoCa Alliance has already brought on board over 60 companies including the country's leading banking institutions, coffee shop chains, and department stores. 

(Korean)
?@?@?@"Credit cards, coupons, and a wide range of mobile gift certificates will all be available on cell phones. It's a service that aims to simplify everything for the customer."

The new system is said to be 90 percent faster than other popular payment methods and much more secure than competing solutions such as Google Wallet.

(Korean)
?@ ?@	?@
"There's no need to store any financial information on the cell phone because it doesn't go through the merchant. This way there are no leaks or risks of exposing financial information. "

?@The MoCa smartphone app is now available to download and use, but consumers shouldn't completely ditch their cash and credit just yet.

Paul Yi, Arirang News?@
artcl_titl: (SAVE)스마트폰, '만능 카드'로 변신#New Mobile Payment System Aims to Replace Wallets#
artcl_titl_en: (SAVE)스마트폰, '만능 카드'로 변신#New Mobile Payment System Aims to Replace Wallets#

artcl_ctt:
?Bright nights ? in the city of Seoul... just got brighter.
City Hall... starting Wednesday... lit all street lamps... in preparation for the upcoming millennial celebrations.
Half of these lights had been turned off... since the financial crisis of late 1997... as a way to save money and electricity.
But again... that is no more.
Plus... all national treasures located in and around the capital... along with buildings higher than 21 floors... will be equipped with lighting... to illuminate Seoul... in time for the celebrations... now just one day away.?

?That''s our regular newscast for the final night of the year.
?And we now ask you to stay tuned... as Arirang TV brings you live coverage... of millennial celebrations... going on in Seoul.
(BRIDGE TITLE)?

? Welcome back.
These celebrations that we''re about to see now... have actually been going on for about half an hour... in the downtown area.

?Our coverage will also include simultaneous translation... as soon as we start bringing you live pictures.
Tonight''s events are being organized by the Presidential Commission for the New Millennium.
And largely... they''re divided into two parts.

? First are the activities of December 31st, 1999... then the January 1st, 2000 portion.

?When we go live to downtown Seoul... and the 광화문 area... we''ll be joining a magnificient car parade... symbolizing the transition from one millennium to another.

?Then a visit by some colorful characters from outer space... what organizers are calling "Galaxy Ambassadors"... accompanied by the flying of 1,999 kites.

?And following that event... we get closer to the long awaited countdown to January first.

---------[추가 ad lib 자료]---------
?Now... minutes before the countdown... the downtown 광화문 area will go all quiet and dark... you''ll only hear the sound of a single traditional Korean bamboo flute... as the symbolic torch there fades slowly.

?  That torch... was lit earlier today by this century''s final sunlight... on the west coast''s 변산반도... and arrived in Seoul escorted by an entourage of 500 motorcycles.

?	As for the countdown itself... laser images of a large pendulum and the number 10 will appear on the nearby 교보 Building.

?
In the southern part of the capital... meanwhile... the 40-story ASEM Building will have a light show of its own... timed to the countdown... lights appearing on every fourth floor... as the numbers change.

?
That''s the venue for the Asia-Europe Meeting... scheduled for next year.
Now... taking place on a runway at the construction site for the Inchon International Airport... 200 people will be in a formation of a wing... and run together... representing the dream of Korea''s economy taking off again.

? Certainly another case of symbolism at work... which is what all the events you''ll see tonight... are all about.
Taking a look at how other parts of Korea will usher in the year 2000... the southern island paradise of 제주... will be the site of an aerial performance to announce the dawning of a new era.

?
Meanwhile... official activities to welcome the first sunrise seen in Korea in 2000... will happen at 6 locations... including Seoul''s Namsan mountain... where kites depicting images of a hundred paintings by famous artists will be flown over the city.

?Also... on Korea''s easternmost island of Tok-do... the new century''s first sunlight will light a torch.?

? Hope this final week of the year is going well.
Here are the top stories at this hour...

? A message of hope from the country''s leader... for the coming new era.

? And... latest calculations suggest the year 2000 will be another prosperous year.

? Also today... a closer look at some major changes in store for the broadcasting industry.?

? Those are the stories at this hour.
Thank you for watching.
Until next time... we wish you a wonderful Wednesday!?

?Bethlehem''s Manger square was crowded with children this week... and it wasn''t just because of Christmas.
Here''s more.
?It was a day of festivities... complete with clowns, balloons, drum and songs.
This is Bethlehem three days after Christmas.... and this celebration bash is called "Remembering the Innocents... an initiative of the Holy Land Trust, a non profit humanitarian organization established to improve the lives of children and families in the Middle East.
Spokesmen said that they wanted to use the day to remind the world that children are still very vulnerable and that children today still are dying because of greed and political conflict, and so they hope to establish the day, December 28 as an international day of remembering the innocents.
The day was picked for it''s symbolic significance.
2000 years ago King Herod fearing that the infant Jesus would put an end to his own reign.. ordered that all male children under 2 be put to death.?

?The "Y2K."
We probably won''t forget those 3 characters... into the new millennium... hearing them so much these days.
Well... despite the talk about worst case scenarios resulting from the computer glitch... there''s a study out showing most Koreans are taking things in stride.
Kim Boram reports.

? More than half of the nation thinks that the Y2K computer problem may at most cause some minor inconveniences.
That''s according to a recent nationwide survey by Taylor Nelson Sofres, a marketing research firm.
11 percent of Koreans believe that Y2K will result in major problems, while 36 percent think there won''t be any problems at all.
The Ministry of Information and Communication issued a ten-point Y2K preparation guideline for the public early last month.
It urges citizens to prepare extra supplies to last them through a few days.
Stores are marketing a variety of products as items for Y2K preparedness.
? "They''re saying that in the year 2000 computers are going to malfunction.
Since I don''t know what''s going to happen exactly, I thought I should prepare in advance.
It''s better to be safe than sorry."
Retailers report brisk sales of products associated with emergency preparations.
Hanhwa Store Corporation has prepared Y2K emergency kits for their customers... the full kit contains bottled water, gas burner, butane gas canisters, candles, matches, rice, ramen and other nonperishable food items.
? "We''ve been preparing for months now and what we''ve done is taken all these separate items and placed them into a box for the convenience of our shoppers.
The items have been selling well and more and more customers are coming here in search of this package."
Store officials report that sales of such items are three to five times above their seasonal norms.
Concerns that Y2K will affect public utilities have prompted many to stock up as a precaution.
? "Koreans are readying themselves for a possible Y2K nightmare.
The mood in supermarkets is not one of panic and hoarding but of thoughtful preparation.
Kim Boram... Arirang TV."?

? Let''s quickly, flip through the local dailies now...

? The millennium fever is heating up around the world... with just three days remaining in this year 19-99.
In Korea, tens of thousands of people are expected to gather on the east coast on the 31st... to catch a glimpse of the first sunrise of the year 2000.
For those in the capital Seoul... planned in the downtown area are performances of rock-and-roll and traditional samulnori bands.

Meantime in China... there will be a commemorative bell-ringing.
Authorities have selected 10-pairs to do the honors... the combined age of the group adds up to one hundred.

Going to the U-S now... President Bill Clinton will host a millennium dinner at the White House.
Afterwards he will attend an official ceremony at the Lincoln Memorial in Washington D-C.
Finally... in the Big Apple... city officials have prepared some 18-hundred tons of confetti for New Year''s celebrations.

In other news...
A North Korean defector says there are South Korean soldiers still being detained in the North.
The defector, who remains anonymous, has given a list of two dozen names... of prisoners of war or POWs.
Of the 24... Seoul officials say 15 of them were previously thought to have died on duty.
The defector also told authorities there were at least 100 living POWs until the mid 19-90''s.

And now... OUR top story for this morning... a rosier economic forecast for the coming year.?

? In the headlines this Wednesday...

? The President announces a special amnesty to free one-million Koreans ahead of the new millennium.

? Seoul predicts the Korean economy will fare better than initial forecasts next year.

? And the government unveils a four-phase plan to privatize Korea Heavy Industries and Construction.?

? Following President Kim''s announcement of a millennial amnesty.... the Justice Ministry announced it will free more than 35-hundred prisoners starting this Friday.
? On the pardon list... are the country''s final two... long-term prisoners... Sohn Song-mo (손성모) and Shin Kwang-soo (신광수)... convicted and jailed for spying for North Korea.
Labor union leaders and student activists are also included.
Plus... more than 6-thousand paroled convicts will be taken off the government''s protective surveillance list.
The Ministry says... there will be greater leniency for those... who''ve committed petty financial crimes... if they turn themselves in during the first three months of the year.?
artcl_titl: 법무부, 대통령담화 후속조치#Justice Ministry announces amnesty#
artcl_titl_en: 법무부, 대통령담화 후속조치#Justice Ministry announces amnesty#

artcl_ctt:
? The nation''s rival parties met today... to prepare an agenda for the proposed summit between their leaders... President Kim Dae-jung and Lee Hoi-chang.
? This... after Lee told reporters yesterday he is willing to meet the president for talks... with no strings attached.
But issues such as Lee''s suggestion that President Kim resign from the ruling party''s top post... have to be settled before the meeting.
The opposition leader is insisting... Kim''s departure from the National Congress for New Politics is the only way to ensure fair competition in next April''s general elections.
The two opposing camps also hope that the Kim-Lee talks will break the deadlock on revising the nation''s election law.?
artcl_titl: 총재회담 실무 회담#Rival parties prepared for DJ-HC meeting#
artcl_titl_en: 총재회담 실무 회담#Rival parties prepared for DJ-HC meeting#

artcl_titl: 김 대통령, 대규모 사면(20세기 송년 특별 담화)
artcl_titl_en: 김 대통령, 대규모 사면(20세기 송년 특별 담화)

artcl_ctt:
? Hello.  Welcome to Hotel Navigation.
I''m Shim Miryung.
With the countdown to the new millennium just __ days away, practically every industry is busier than ever testing their computers for the Y2K bug.
Hotels are no exception...
Let''s see how some of the five star hotels in Seoul... striving to provide cutting-edge business technology as well as luxury and comfort... are preparing for the coming millennium.

?

? Relatedly ... General Motor''s bid for Daewoo Motor appears to be on track...
The US auto giant says... it''ll officially announce plans to purchase the automaker... at the Detroit Motor Show slated to open early next January.
? A source at GM Korea said on Monday GM President Rick Wagoner is set to hold a press conference during the motor show.
Daewoo Motor''s bankruptcy last month had a ripple effect... halting operations at thousands of its suppliers and contractors.
But, following a one-month suspension... factory lines started running again on Monday... after union workers gave in to creditors'' demands for aggressive restructuring.?

? This year''s astounding rally on the local stock market is largely thanks to bullish foreign investors.
The central bank reports net inflow of funds by foreigners totalled five billion dollars... while their total purchase more than doubled the figure from the previous year.

? The combined foreign stock investment in Korea, including inflow and outflows, posted 77-point-1 billion dollars.
?That''s the greatest since 19-92 when the bourse first opened to foreign investors and is 2-point-7 times last year''s total.?
Meanwhile, the net inflow as of December 26th was ?5-point-1 billion dollars.
That translates to 6-point-0-7 trillion won and is the second highest since 19-93''s 5-point-7 billion dollars.?
The net capital inflow by foreigners surged in 19-93 ?following the market liberalization the previous year.
The figure regained its pace from ''94 but took a plunge three years later due to the regional foreign exchange crisis.
But that regained strength along with the economic recovery.? 
In another perspective, foreign investors had a banner year with the national currency appreciating by 14-point-9 percent.
That led to increased F/X earnings going out of the country.
A Bank of Korea official says the increased capital flow of foreign stock investment has a postive effect on the country''s F/X market.
But he adds the huge liquidity across borders turned out to a variable to the won''s fluctuation.?
artcl_titl: Foreign investment in stocks#foreign net investment in stocks#
artcl_titl_en: Foreign investment in stocks#foreign net investment in stocks#

artcl_ctt:
? Prosecutors plan to indict the head of Kumho Petrochemical... on charges of manipulating share prices.
? Park Chan-koo (박찬구), however, will not be physically detained.
Park is accused of using insider information... to pocket 12 and a half billion won in illegal profits.
He allegedly bought shares in Kumho Tire last April... based on his knowledge of the then-undisclosed merger... between the tire company and Kumho''s construction unit.
Park''s three brothers were also questioned in connection with the scheme...
But, prosecutors are not expected to take legal action against the three.
The prosecution plans to make a formal announcement on its probe tomorrow.?
artcl_titl: 금호 박찬구 사장 불구속 기소키로#Kumho Petrochemical head to be indicted#
artcl_titl_en: 금호 박찬구 사장 불구속 기소키로#Kumho Petrochemical head to be indicted#

artcl_ctt:
? Hello and welcome to Newsroom Update.


?The President''s scheduled to give a national... year-end address this morning.
During his speech... he''s expected to thank Koreans for their sacrifice and cooperation... in overcoming the foreign exchange crisis of late 19-97.
But at the same time... President Kim will likely warn against complacency... saying the so-called IMF era may be over... but there''s still ways to go before the economy regains its former strength.
The President''s message will be televised live nationwide.

?The government now predicts next year''s G-D-P growth rate to reach six percent...
That''s one percent higher than its earlier forecast.
And during the time... inflation is likely to be lower than initial expectations... staying in the two percent range.
Authorities also believe the current account surplus will exceed 12-billion dollars... while the unemployment rate will fall to... four-point-five percent.
The revised outlook reflects the government''s economic plans for the new year... which the Ministry of Finance and Economy will release early next month.


?

? An estimated 370-thousand workers will be on standby to cope with any ? problems arising from the Y2K computer glitch.
From now until January fourth, 13 core sectors including finance, utilities, communications and transportation will operate their own task forces.
The Information and Communication Ministry stressed the government is 100 percent Y2K compliant for the 13 sectors.
But it said it cannot declare the computer glitch to be completely solved.
It has asked citizens to alert the ministry of related agencies or post any problems ? on the web at "y2000.nca.or.kr".?
Some 30-thousand people from the nation''s top 30 conglomerates and 100-thousand in the country''s hospitals will also be on emergency alert over the holiday weekend.?
artcl_titl: Y2K-Emergency Setup#gov''t sets up emergency system#
artcl_titl_en: Y2K-Emergency Setup#gov''t sets up emergency system#

artcl_ctt:
? In his year-end speech, President Kim Dae-jung pinpointed political wrangling as the biggest obstacle to the country''s development.
And one announcement... included in his remarks... was about a special... millennial amnesty... that''ll affect a million Koreans.
Here''s Ahn Jung-hyun.

? Seeking redemption for... and saying goodbye to the wrongful practices and errors of our ways in the past.
That''s what President Kim called the declaration of freedom... through which we can all be reborn.
And promoting reconciliation and unity across all sectors of society... is a precondition to opening a new millennium of hope.
The President especially emphasized the need for the political sector to lead the way... saying partisan bickering was the biggest obstacle to national development.

? "(SOT) Now is the time for the ruling and opposition camps to start a new era of politics by uniting and cooperating as partners in state affairs."

Referring to the recent scandals involving high-profile politicians and government officials... President Kim said he would follow the principles in dealing with them... but that he was willing to show as much leniency as possible.
And in a gesture of reconciliation... the President said the government would grant parole to certain prisoners... while taking parolees off probation.
It would also ease or lift punitive measures imposed on those who committed crimes amid economic difficulties... in order to maintain their livelihood.

? "(SOT) Such government measures will benefit about one million Koreans.  I sincerely wish them new hope and advancement in their future."

Plus... President Kim would grant amnesty to 2 long-term prisoners and 7 political prisoners.
? With the year-end pardon... he added... there would be no more public security offenders serving long-term sentences in Korea.
He called on these million people to return to society and do what they can to achieve national unity and economic growth.
Ahn Junghyun... Arirang TV.
(cut after president says thanks)?

?Meanwhile... the final blueprint is out to privatize Korea Heavy Industries and Construction... also called Hanjung.
?Commerce, Industry, and Energy Minister Chung Duk-koo (정덕구) announced a four-phase plan yesterday.
Under which... Seoul will first form a strategic alliance with foreign firms including General Electric and ABB.
These companies are expected to buy up to a 25 percent stake in Hanjung.
That''s while 24-percent of Hanjung shares will be listed on the KOSPI next April.
As step number 3... the government will arrange an open bid... and choose a majority shareholder among Korean companies.
If THAT doesn''t happen... the rest of Hanjung''s stocks will be sold off in the first half of the year 2001.?
artcl_titl: 한국 중공업 민영화  발표#A plan to privatize korea heavy industries#
artcl_titl_en: 한국 중공업 민영화  발표#A plan to privatize korea heavy industries#

artcl_ctt: ? Hello and welcome to Biz.Today... for Wednesday, December the 29th.?

? That''s all for this Wednesday''s edition of Biz Today.
Thanks for watching... and take care.?

? Six life insurers that are set to be taken over by healthier firms... have received public funds worth one-point-nine trillion won.
? The money will go toward covering debts... which exceed assets... at the six companies.
The latest injection follows a similar move last month... through which 1-point-8 trillion won was pumped into the ailing firms.
Dong-ah Life Insurance received the most money this time around... at nearly one-trillion won... followed by Kookmin and Doowon.?
artcl_titl: 부실 생명보험 공적자금 1조 9천억 투입#Public funds injected into 6 ailing life insurers#
artcl_titl_en: 부실 생명보험 공적자금 1조 9천억 투입#Public funds injected into 6 ailing life insurers#

artcl_ctt:
? Starting next March... foreigners investing in areas like Seoul''s Itaewon and Pusan''s Haeundae (해운대)... will be eligible for various incentives.
That''s according to a government plan to include all ?19 special tourist zones... in areas designated for foreign investment.
The benefits include relaxed land transfer regulations and income tax breaks... among others.
It will also become easier to report investment plans for tourism projects within these special zones to relevant authorities.?
artcl_titl: 관광특구, ''외국인 투자지역'' 편입#Tourist zone-foreign investment zone#
artcl_titl_en: 관광특구, ''외국인 투자지역'' 편입#Tourist zone-foreign investment zone#

artcl_titl_en: 박준규 국회의장,당적 이탈 제도 입법화 요구

artcl_ctt:
?Heads of conglomerates are planning to spend their New Year holidays overseas or on Mount Kumgang....to plan ahead on their corporate strategies for the new millenium or simply to take a rest.
?According to Hyundai Group...the founder Chung Juyung and his son will spend their New Year holidays in Mount Kumang.
While Samsung Group chairman Lee Kunhee will be visiting a semi-conductor production facility in Austin, Texas.
Chairman Hyun Jaehyun of Tongyang Group...ranking 20th in corporate size...also left for U-S to visit the company branch.
There are also many other corporate heads staying at home to spend the New Year with their family members.?
artcl_titl: Big Corporate Heads Planning to Spend New Year Holidays Overseas
artcl_titl_en: Big Corporate Heads Planning to Spend New Year Holidays Overseas

artcl_ctt:
?This year...major PC makers produced around 6-point-3 percent of the entire world market..out pacing other PC producing countries.
?If the trend continues...Korea''s PC production is expected to surpass 10-million units next year...carving out a 10-percent world market share.
The driving force is due to TriGem and its partner Korea Data System...which entered the United States PC market with its low-price model named "eMachines".
At the same time...both domestic and overseas PC markets gained higher growth due to the so called "Free PC" marketing... led by Internet service providers which lowers costs for consumers.?
artcl_titl: PC production to surpass 10mil. units next year
artcl_titl_en: PC production to surpass 10mil. units next year

artcl_ctt:
? Prosecutors will summon today Kumho Group chairman Park Jung-koo (박정구)... amid allegations of stock price rigging.
? Overnight... they questioned his brother Park Sam-gu (박삼구)... president of Asiana Airlines.
Authorities are trying to find out... whether Park, along with his brothers... used inside information... to illegally reap profits.
They allegedly sold shares in Kumho Tires to the group''s petrochemical unit last April... prior to their merger... and thereby made a profit of 920-million won.
Authorities also cross-examined the Asiana president''s testimony... with statements given by Park Chan-koo(박찬구)... head of the petrochemical divison.
Both men have strongly denied the charges... insisting the stock transactions were an attempt to defend their management rights.?
artcl_titl: 검찰, 금호회장 부른다#Kumho chairman to be summoned today#
artcl_titl_en: 검찰, 금호회장 부른다#Kumho chairman to be summoned today#

artcl_ctt:
? World oil prices broke through the 26 dollars-per-barrel mark Monday...
? The surge followed remarks by Iran''s oil minister... that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries... or OPEC... was likely to extend its oil supply curbs by another six months... after a meeting in March.
Over on the New York Mercantile Exchange... Texas crude for February delivery... closed 46 cents higher than last Friday... at 26 dollars and 33 cents a barrel.?
artcl_titl: 국제 유가 반등...26달러선#Oil prices rise beyond $26#
artcl_titl_en: 국제 유가 반등...26달러선#Oil prices rise beyond $26#

artcl_ctt: ? Good of you to join us on Biz.Today.?

? The local stock market closed this last trading session of the year... at an annual high.
The benchmark KOSPI shot up 22 points or two-percent... to one-thousand-28.
Analysts say anticipation of a bull run early next year... fueled buying among individual investors.
Trading volume totalled 253 million shares... on turnover of almost 4-point-7 trillion won.
Decliners outpaced advancers by a five to three margin... while 48 issues remained unchanged.
25 shares reached their limit highs and 75 dropped to their limit lows.

A closer look now... at some major stocks.?

? For those music lovers out there... welcome the new millennium as you pay tribute to the 100th anniversary of Johann Strauss.
The ''Black Tie Affair'' at the Seoul Hilton offers an extravagant new year''s eve package where you can enjoy a Champagne reception, a six course dinner with wine and waltz to live orchestra.
And between December 30th and January 2nd, the hotel also offers a millennium package that includes free cocktails and fitness club usage.

? Millennium Party
    Entrance Fee: 199,900 won (service charge and tax included)

    Millennium Package
    Price: 99,000 won per night (excluding service charge and tax/Koreans only)

? The Radisson Plaza Hotel in Seoul held a charity event for

Korea National Tourism Organization
 recently announced the results of its survey on foreign tourists visiting Korea.
More than 2-thousand visitors responded to the survey at the country''s majjor airports between March and October of this year.
Topping the list of visitors'' favorite travel sites... city tours, casinos and hot springs.
The most popular items on their shopping list were kimchi, clothing and cosmetics.
Most Asian travelers people picked Tongdaemun as their number one shopping district... showing a slight drop in the popularity of Itaewon.
When asked what impressed them most... majority of the foreign tourists pointed to people''s friendliness, Korea''s traditional food, and diverse shopping outlets.
But they pointed out several drawbacks... including the language barrier and insufficient roadsigns.

? Now to Seoul''s plans to boost the tourism sector...
? The Ministry of Culture and Tourism says it''ll set aside more than 45 billion won... or 38 million dollars... in tourism promotion funds.
The money will come in the form of loans... to help develop or renovate resort condominiums... as well as eateries and entertainment facilities for foreigners.
These loans come with a six-percent interest rate... and are repayable in two to five years... with a minimum one-year grace period.
Those interested in applying for the loans... should file a form with the Korea Development Bank by January 15th.?
artcl_titl: #Gov''t to Provide 37 Million Dollars for Tourism Development#
artcl_titl_en: #Gov''t to Provide 37 Million Dollars for Tourism Development#

artcl_ctt:
? The government says it will create more jobs this winter.
? The Cabinet today decided to allocate more than one-third of next year''s budget... for various public works and infrastructure projects... that will be undertaken during the first quarter.
The government says the move takes into consideration... the fact that many college graduates are still having a hard time finding jobs... despite a recent decline in the unemployment rate.
To curb inflation however... the government plans to closely monitor... the distribution of funds for the jobless.?
artcl_titl: 정부,내년 1.4분기 예산 중점배정#Gov''t measures on job security#
artcl_titl_en: 정부,내년 1.4분기 예산 중점배정#Gov''t measures on job security#

artcl_ctt:
? And here''s what tomorrow''s weather looks like... in cities around the Asia-Pacific.
?

? The Cabinet has approved 46 revised items to Korea''s labor laws.
? One key change... would be allowing former union members to be paid wages from the year 2002... as long as there''s agreeement between labor and management.
These proposed revisions now await National Assembly approval.
Also during yesterday''s meeting... President Kim said the government should help create more jobs for the middle class and workers... who suffered most from the economic crisis.
To that end... the President ordered an early execution of the budget earmarked for that bracket next year.?
artcl_titl: 2002 노조전임자 급여(22KBR)#Govt okays wages to ex-union members from 2002#허용
artcl_titl_en: 2002 노조전임자 급여(22KBR)#Govt okays wages to ex-union members from 2002#허용

artcl_ctt:
? Picking up a phone... making your call... and getting billed for the conversation later on... may soon become things of the past here in Korea.
The telecom industry... next year... is planning to introduce a no-pay system of dialing out... in cyberspace.

? The only inconvenience of the Internet phone service, is that you need a computer to make an out-going call.
But that''s a small price to pay for FREE calls.
Local, long-distance, and even international calls are ALL provided at no charge.
The sponsor of an ad posted at the top of the web page... pays the telephone fees.
The sound quality... is like a regular mobile phone.
Once a user logs on to the dial pad website, the company''s high-speed ADSL network allows the person to make a regular phone call anywhere.
That means, the receiver doesn''t have to be anywhere near a computer.
Hanaro Telecom hooked up with Serome Technologies to develop and provide the computer-to-phone service... which will debut on January 5th.
Even non-Hanaro subscribers will be able to use the service... which requires no special software, just a computer microphone, speaker and a sound card.
The new service is expected to spark intense competition among phone service providers... slashing prices... and quickly ushering in an era of free telephone calls.?
artcl_titl: 무료 인터넷 전화시대 # Free Internet Phone Calls #
artcl_titl_en: 무료 인터넷 전화시대 # Free Internet Phone Calls #
